loans.name: Siempre 10 Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Rosa pertenece al grupo “Siempre 10 al Progreso”  donde el ambiente es cordial
 Y ameno, Rosa es casada con 4 hijos uno de ellos menor de edad, Rosa se dedica al negocio de  alquiler de juegos recreativos hace diez años, Rosa lleva tres años en  EDAPROSPO y agradece  por el préstamo adquirido ya que le está permitiendo  realizar una de sus metas de poner su librería se siente contenta y entusiasmada de saber que hay inversionista extranjeros como KIVA  que ayudan a personas a crecer en sus negocios. Rosa  está feliz de saber que si sigue así va a poder  cumplir otro de sus sueños que es poner una boutique y poder ayudar a su familia. Gracias KIVA sigan ayudando a gente que tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y no saben como.
texts.en: Rosa belongs to the "Siempre 10 al Progreso" group, where the atmosphere is cordial and pleasant.  Rosa is married and has 4 children, one of whom is under age.  For the past 10 years, Rosa has worked in her business renting recreational games.  Rosa has been in EDAPROSPO for three years, and she is grateful for the loan she has received as it is allowing her to reach one of her goals of opening a bookstore.  She is happy and enthusiastic that there are foreign investors like KIVA who help people grow in their businesses.  Rosa is happy knowing that if she continues this way, she will be able to achieve more of her dreams such as opening a boutique and helping her family.  She wants to thank KIVA and encourage them to continue helping people who have a desire to get ahead but do not know how to.

loans.use: start her business by purchasing merchandise for her bookstore such as: office supplies, display cases and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old, married, and from Nyandarua South. He and his wife have two children who are between 13 and 18 years old.

Joseph has a wool spinning business that he has been running for many years and has applied for his fourth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy more wool to add to his stock.  He will use the profits made to buy a spinning machine.

He hopes to improve his livelihood and business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more wool

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 52 year old, married father of three children in Embu who earns a living from operating a maize milling business. He is married to Rael, who helps him run the business. He also sells cereals to his customers to supplement his income. 

This marks his third loan term with VISIONFUND KENYA after repaying his previous loans successfully. He intends to use the loan to purchase spare parts for his milling machine and purchase more maize for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to pay for his children’s school fees and buy food for the family. 

He hopes to see all his children well educated and self-reliant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his milling machine and purchase more maize for sale

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives in Surenavan village in the Ararat region of Armenia. She lives with her parents-in-law, husband, and two school-age children. Ani's father-in-law works at a local mining company and her mother-in-law is retired and receives a pension. 
Together with her husband, Ani has been involved in farming for 10 years. They grow 80 apricot trees. They sell the gathered harvest both locally and in nearby countries. Due to their hard work over these years, Ani and her husband were able to build a successful farm. 
Ani applied for this loan of USD 1,500 to be able to purchase fertilizer and cover watering costs. Because of many daily costs, Ani and her husband weren't able to save money for their farming activities and this loan will greatly help them.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and cover watering costs

loans.name: Nehar

texts.en:
Nehar is 29 years old and lives in a small hut alongside with her husband in Maynaguri, district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband is a farmer. She is blessed with two children, and they are receiving education. Nehar has the basic education. 

Nehar is a hardworking housewife. She and her husband have their own agricultural land where they cultivate different vegetables in different seasons and sell those vegetables in the market. Now they want to cultivate bitter gourd. They have their own land and experience in the agricultural field; this is the reason for choosing bitter gourd cultivation. Nehar helps her husband in the field. She wishes to take the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her bitter gourd cultivation. 

She wants to extend her land in the future and is planning to build a concrete house for living. Environmental disasters like drought, flood and famine are the main hitches in her agricultural business. Nehar is a very ambitious and courageous lady who never gives up the fight before she proves herself as a good cultivator. She hopes to earn a huge profit from this business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for helping her financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for farming bitter gourd on her own land.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 35-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Samson who is a civil servant. They have three children aged 11, 10, and 8 years old.

Pamela is a stylist and sells braids and weaves. She has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

She is taking loan of 75,000 KES. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya to use for buying a blow dryer and chemicals. She will use her profits to expand her salon, to buy more weaves, and to repay her loan.

Pamela has a dream of bringing up a happy family and opening a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of braids and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela es una joven de 22 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad con un clima variado y en el cual se encuentran playas hermosas y una gastronomía muy variada. Pamela es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tal es así que ella estudia la carrera de Ciencias de la comunicación y para poder solventar sus estudios trabaja como asistente en una institución de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y por las noches acude a su centro de estudios; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Pamela está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan esta oportunidad y gracias a ello podrá comprar mercadería como bermudas, bivirís, polos, faldas, entre otros ya que para ofrecer estos productos a sus compañeros de clase y de trabajo, con lo cual podrá tener un ingreso extra, así como también poder pagar su matrícula para la universidad. Así ella podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Trabajar en una gran empresa de periodismo del país”.
texts.en:
Pamela is 22 years old and lives in the city of Chincha, a city with a varied climate with beautiful beaches and very diverse foods.  Pamela is a young woman with a strong desire to get ahead, which is why she is studying to enter a career in communications.  In order to pay for her education, she works as an assistant in an institution in her city.  She works around eight hours a day, and at night she goes to school.  She believes that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and because she has such a strong desire to get ahead.  

Pamela is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because this is the second time that they have given her this opportunity, and thanks to it she will be able to purchase merchandise such as bermuda shorts, briefs, polo shirts, and skirts among others that she can sell to her classmates and coworkers to earn an extra income to be able to pay her tuition.  This will allow her to keep fighting to make her dream of working for a large national newspaper a reality.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives with his mother in Yerevan. He is already a fourth year student who also works at a local supermarket as a seller. 

Andranik has already taken a loan with the help of SEF International and Kiva which helped him to cover his university tuition for last year's second semester. Now, by applying for another loan, Andranik is asking lenders to support him with this year's tuition. 

He is very satisfied with the successful cooperation of Kiva and SEF International and would like to continue.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla was born in 1968. She is a married woman living in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Abla has been supporting her husband for 3 years by selling popcorn and handmade cotton candy at her own kiosk. She is now applying for a loan to buy a special machine for making cotton candy in order to raise her productivity.

loans.use: to buy a special machine for making cotton candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a juice machine

loans.name: Krobor Bukum Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the featured borrower of this group and is very well known in Teshie, where she excels at selling groceries and electrical equipment. She plans to use her loan to buy groceries (Coca-Cola, milk, energy drinks, Milo drinks, energy-saving bulbs, electrical wires, etc.) to sell to her customers. She procures her goods locally and in Accra from wholesalers and makes her retail sales in Teshie for cash. She is married with two dependable children. 

She and the other lady are part of the group called Krobor Bukum and they are composed of two members who know each other and are from the same neighborhood. They are people with the average age of 36 years old with two children. They live in large traditional families in Teshie, Accra. The group members engage in different kinds of businesses, especially the buying and selling of groceries, electrical equipment, underwear and kids' clothing. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought-after. In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join ID Ghana's loan program. They are on their fourth loan. 

Elizabeth hopes to earn a good profit from this loan cycle which will be used for repayment of the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling (Coca-Cola, milk, energy drinks, Milo drinks, energy-saving bulbs, electrical wires, etc.). The group needs a total loan amount of GHS 2,000 to be able to serve their customers best.

loans.use: To buy groceries (Coca-Cola, milk, energy drinks, Milo drinks, energy-saving bulbs, electrical wires, etc.) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Greda Traders Group

texts.en:
These two members are part of the group called Greda Traders.  The group consists of men who manufacture metal shop containers, brake fluid and fan belts.  They are asking for their second loan from ID-Ghana. They all work to get ahead. 
 
One of the members, Amos, is 35-years-old. He works every day for very long hours. He is a mechanic who also sells brake fluid and fan belts and has loyal customers who always buy products they need from him. 

Amos is requesting a loan to purchase brake fluid and fan belts to sell and fulfill his goal to continue offering customers with everything they need.

loans.use: To purchase brake fluid and a fan belt to sell

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel es madre de familia y habita en el barrio La Fuente ubicado en la periferia de la ciudad de Managua, desde hace varios años se dedica a la actividad de comercio, el cual le ha permitido cancelar los cuatro créditos anteriores, habiendo sido destinados para la mejora de condiciones de su casa; ella asegura que gracias al gran esfuerzo que realiza podrá terminar de construir su propia casa. Reina solicita el crédito para la compra de los siguientes materiales de construcción tales como zinc, perlines, golozos y pintura, con ellos cambiará gran parte el techo de su casa que en temporada lluviosa no presta las condiciones.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel is the mother of her family and lives in the La Fuente neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Managua.  For many years, she has devoted herself to business, which has allowed her to pay off her four previous loans that were used to make repairs to her house.  She is certain that thanks to her great effort she will be able to finish building her own home.

Reina is requesting this loan to purchase the following construction materials: zinc, purlins, screws and paint.  With these, she will replace a large portion of the roof of her house because during the rainy season it leaks.

loans.use: purchase construction materials such as: zinc, purlins, screws and paint.

loans.name: Jhonattan

texts.es: El señor Jhonattan tiene 19 años, el se dedica  a la actividad del tejido de buzos, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Catacora, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  solicita este préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer ya que tiene muchos pedidos ya que el realiza las prendas según  pedido, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, el señor Jhonattan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son poder ofrecer sus productos en distintos mercados de la ciudad de El alto,  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Jhonattan is 19 years old and he dedicates himself to knitting items of clothing. His shop and domicile are  in the zone of Catacora. This is the 1st loan cycle he has participated in with this institution. Jhonattan is requesting the loan to purchase a knitting machine because he has many orders to fill. He makes clothing by order. His is soliciting this loan is to increase his working capital.

Jhonattan confronts challenges in his business such as being able to offer his products in distinct markets of the city of El Alto. He will utilize these funds to buy a knitting machine and, at wholesale, the materials he requires for knitting his items of clothing.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 48 years old and lives with her family in Vanadzor in the Lori region. She is married and has a daughter and a son. 

After her first successful Kiva loan which she used to buy a computer, she decided to obtain her second loan. She hopes the loan is no less successful and useful. 

Nelli has higher teaching education and 23 years of teaching experience. Now, she works at the school as a teacher of mathematics and also gives private mathematics courses to prepare pupils to have higher scores on the entrance examinations. Her pupils say that she is a very strict and fastidious teacher and at the same time a very patient and kind person. 

She does her best to pass her knowledge on to her pupils. As she says to her pupils, mathematics is the most useful subject during their life, and without its knowledge, men cannot overcome their everyday needs. 

Nelli greatly thanks Kiva and Nor Horizon for her first loan and asks for her second loan for the purchase of numerous methodological and mathematics books. She will use some of the loan to pay for the computer skills courses in which she needs to take part in order to be able to work with her computer.

loans.use: to purchase numerous methodological and mathematics books and computer skills classes.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 50-year-old woman from the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is an illiterate housewife but knows how to sign her name. She is a mother of one son. 

Her husband repairs cars. He has a small motor repair shop in the market. Unfortunately, her son is deprived of receiving an education due to their poverty and is a car driver to contribute toward the family's expenses. 

Her husband has been working as a motor mechanic for more than 10 years. He started this business to increase his income and improve his life. It was an impressive step forward for the family’s well-being but he is unable to give a better life to his family, specifically he can't provide an education to his only son. So he needs to expand his business by purchasing more motor spare parts.

Kalpana has taken the initiative to help her husband.  She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  They want to use the loan to purchase more motor spare parts.  She hopes that she will be capable of developing her family business and can generate more income to give a better life to her family.

She gives her heartiest thanks to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for making her family happy.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her husband's car repair business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, coal, Maggi cubes, and salt.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a conservative lady, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Rana was born in 1985. She has three daughters. She has been supporting her husband financially by selling desserts to her neighbors for three years after she gained experience of making desserts from working at a dessert store in the past. She is planning to open her own independent shop in the future to raise her sales and productivity. Now she seeks a youth loan to buy more raw materials to make new types of desserts.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make new types of desserts

loans.name: Sunil

texts.en: Sunil is 31-years-old and lives with his wife and parents. He works at the hospital as a porter. Sunil’s father cultivated rice before and is now pensioned off, so Sunil took over his business with the support of Seva MFI and now he has an extra income. If Seva MFI had not supported him he would have had to rent his father’s fields. Sunil started with rice cultivation on a plot of 2 hectares and in the coming season he plans to sow 10 hectares. For this, he needs SRD 7,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides. In the future, Sunil wants to expand his areas so that he can make more profits and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is a housewife of 42 years who lives with her husband and one son in Maynaguri village. She is illiterate and can only sign her name.  Her husband studied up to grade seven. They are not capable of providing an education for their son, so he is engaged in the family business.

Shikha assists her husband in running his spicy puffed rice business. They sell spicy puffed rice as tasty tiffin snacks in their area. Shikha prepares the puffed rice with oil, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, shallots and coriander leaves along with chili powder and salt to make it tastier. She works hard all day long to make the spicy puffed rice and her husband sells it in the market place, in front of schools and many other congested areas. She is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more spicy and tasty items for her spicy puffed rice business. She thinks it will help her to fulfill the local demand and earn more profit through her business.

Shikha got help from BJS and Kiva so she is always grateful to them.

loans.use: To purchase tasty ingredients for her spicy puffed rice business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a farmer living in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya with her two children, who are of school-going age.  She has been farming for the past 10 years with her income coming from milk, eggs, tea, horticultural crops, transportation services and a retail business.

What she enjoys most in farming is poultry farming where she gets enough money to take good care of her children, while her biggest challenge is insufficient capital and poor markets.

Florence chose Juhudi Kilimo because they reach small holder farmers in the rural areas.  During the training, she learned how to develop a savings culture.  Through the use of this loan, she will be able to get more income and, thus, enable her to pay her children's school fees comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Falha

texts.en: Falha was born in 1963. She is married and has six sons and daughters. Falha has been raising goats and selling them and their products since her childhood. After she got married, she made her business a good source of income to help her husband cover their children needs. Now she is seeking a loan to expand the quantity of goats she has in order to raise her profit.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a 44-year-old married woman. 

She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals like baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and then, sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough money from her business to contribute to the family income. Rasheedan is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Rasheedan needs to improve her business to support her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. 

With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Aissatou Combe's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois courant deuxième semestre 2013. Ce groupe est composé de femmes très dynamiques qui partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide été elles vivent dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou  (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 61 ans, est mariée et mère de 02 garçons qui ont atteint la majorité. Cependant malgré son âge avancé elle demeure une femme très dynamique. Elle s’active dans la préparation de gâteaux qu’elle vend dans on quartier et les quartiers aux alentours. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter une quantité importante de farine, du sucre et autres ingrédients pour la préparation de gâteaux.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille surtout sur le plan culinaire.
texts.en:
Created at the inception of the local banc villageois in the second quarter of 2013, this group is composed of three very energetic women who have a strong solidarity spirit among them. They all have been living in the same neighborhood for some years. They mainly work as vendors.
Mrs. Aissatou (the one seated on the right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 61 years old, married and the mother of two adult sons. In spite of her age, she remains a very energetic person. She  bakes cakes for sale in her own neighborhood and nearby. She has a lot of experience in this business as she has been doing it for a number of years.

loans.use: to stock up on flower, sugar and other ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 28-year-old lady from the Kisumu region which is located in the western part of Kenya. 

She sells sandals and footwear and has been in this business for the last five years. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

Jackline has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to increase her working capital and will earn more income from the business to sustain her family of two children who are 1 and 11 years old.

Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz was born in 1968. She is married and has 3 daughters. Shahnaz has been supporting her family financially by selling blankets and electronic machines to her friends and neighbors at her house for the past two years. She is planning to keep on expanding her project until she has her own independent store. Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a larger quantity of her products in order to raise her profits.

loans.use: to bring in more blankets and electronic machines for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and machines that he needs to repair cars

loans.name: Coop Isabane 2014B Gp2 Group

texts.en:
Liberathe is a member of Coop Isabane 2014B Gp2 Group. She is married, with four children, aged between eight and twelve. Her husband works as a farmer and they have spent fifteen years in the rice farming business. 

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, Liberathe wishes to invest in her business, so that, in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is 40 years old and lives in the village of Gandzakar in the Tavush region. He is married and lives with his parents, wife, and two children. His parents are employed, and they try to support their son with his family needs. 

Ararat is engaged in farming and agriculture. He has land for cultivation on which he grows potatoes, greens, cabbage, and apple trees. He also has a hay field for his cattle. On his farm, he has three cows, two calves, a heifer, and 20 chickens. 

His farm goods like milk, meat, and eggs are sold by his wife from their house. Ararat’s mother makes a perfect and tasty cheese. Sometimes, they have great orders from their neighbors. 

Ararat loves his farm very much and takes care of it all day long with great pleasure. He is asking for a loan from Kiva for the purchase of pigs, seven piglets, and fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, piglets, and fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 50-year-old married woman. She has a business selling cloth in her locality. She always has a great collection to offer to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will help her to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs. 

With this loan amount, she will be able to inflate her sales and profits. She wishes to spend a part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 22-year-old lady from Kisumu County. She is married to Hezekiah who is a businessman. They have two children aged 7 and 2 years old.

She sells materials and blankets. She has been in this business for the last six years and earns an income of 25,000 KES per month. 

Ruth has applied for a third loan of 90,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to expand her business. 

The profits will be used to educate her children and to repay the loan. Ruth has a dream of expanding to be a wholesaler in this sector.

loans.use: to purchase bails and rolls of untailored materials to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 23-year-old single businessman who operates an agrovet shop in Embu. He has operated this business for the past two years. Joseph also runs a retail shop, a business that supplements his monthly income. His main challenge is insufficient capital to keep the store well stocked. Because of this, he has been unable to attract more customers and expand the business. He earns a monthly income of KES 15500, which he uses to support himself and his parents. 

A loan from VISIONFUND KENYA will allow Joseph to purchase pesticides, animal feed, and poultry products. With the additional income he will earn from the sale of these products, he plans to reinvest in the business. He wants to be able to continue to support his parents. 

In the future, he hopes to expand his business to become a larger agrovet store.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, animal feed and poultry products.

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en:
Sardar is a 58-year-old married lady. She has run a small general store in her community for many years. 

She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy more stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She will then be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. 

Sardar wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bring in mobile phones and accessories for her store

loans.name: José Toribio

texts.es:
José de 21 años de edad. Luchador y esmerado desde muy pequeño. Por sus escasos recursos económicos alcanzo hasta el 4º grado de educación básica.

José vive con su esposa y su Bebé, desde muy chico comenzó a trabajar esto lo obligo a dejar sus estudios, a medida pasaba el tiempo aprendió la labor de estructuras metálicas y a la reparación de bicicletas, esto le ha generado mucha ganancia pues es un labor que no es muy común en su comunidad, ademas de eso José en su tiempo libre se dedica a pescar y en parte a la agricultura. Es un hombre esforzado y con muchos deseos de salir adelante. El efectivo del préstamo sera utilizado para instalar su propio negocio, quiere emprender su propia aventura. Comprara Llantas, rines, Parches entre otros materiales que son básicos en el taller de bicicletas.

A futuro sueña tener un negocio propio que crezca en gran medida, que sea su esposa quien se involucre en el y que su pequeño hijo pueda desarrollarse plenamente, sacar sus estudios y que sean un hombre de provecho. Él sabe que con su esfuerzo y dedicación lograra sus objetivos.
texts.en:
José is 21-years old.  He has been has hard working and conscientious since he was small.  Due to his family's low income, he only attended school until 4th grade. 

José lives with his wife and their baby.  He started working at a very young age, which meant he had to stop going to school.  After a while, he learned to work with metal structures and repair bicycles.  This work has been very profitable for him, as it is a job that is not very common in his community.  In addition, in his free time José earns money fishing and doing a bit of farming.  He is a hard working man with a great desire to get ahead.  The loan he is taking out will be used to set up his own business; he wants to start up his own venture.  He will purchase tires, rims, patches and other materials that are basic to a bicycle workshop. 

In the future, José  hopes to have his own business and see it grow a great deal.  He hopes that his wife can be involved in the business.  And he hopes for his young son to develop to the fullest, finish school and become a good man.  José knows that with his hard work and dedication, he will achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase tires, rims, patches and other materials that are basic to a bicycle workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 36-year-old general trader in Majengo, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single mother who supports one child. She has been in this business for the last nine years and is doing great.

This marks her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase sugar, eggs, and office stationary for resale in her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to service her loan and expand her business. She hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, eggs, and office stationary for her shop

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a 43-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children, from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in fishing and a seaweed farming business for more than 20 years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Glenda is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and materials for seaweed farming, like straw, nylon, and seaweed seedlings. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Moreover, they will be able to improve the productivity of their seaweed farming, as well. 

In the future, Ma. Glenda hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and materials for seaweed farming, like straw, nylon, and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Meet Monica, a farmer living in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya with her husband and three children. 

Monica has been doing farming for the past 12 years, where her primary source of income is milk, eggs, tea, crops, and a retail business. She says that what she enjoys about farming is getting higher returns and minimizing costs, while her biggest challenges are poor markets and insufficient rainfall.

Monica chose Juhudi Kilimo because they reach the small-scale farmers in the rural areas who need asset financing. During the training, she learned about planning and budgeting, which helps her as a farmer. Through this loan her children will  be able to complete school comfortably.

loans.use: to plant horticultural crops.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years old and he is married. They have six children who are aged between 22 and 12 years old.

Daniel has a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past three years. He has applied for his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to boost his other business of selling milk.

He hopes to improve his business in the near future and improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to boost dairy business by buying milk.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 37 years old, from Naivasha, and he is married. They have three children who are aged between 12 and 2 years old.

Jeremiah has a charcoal business that he has been running for the past seven years. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy more charcoal to add to his stock.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future and be able to be the leading charcoal seller in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman and a mother of six children, from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in a food-vending business, selling processed foods, like meat, hot dogs, and other goods, like noodles, canned sardines, and other items. This is the source of her income.

Cristina is asking for a loan to buy more food stocks to sell, like canned goods, processed meat, like hot dogs, chicken, bananas, sugar, and other items. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more goods to her customers. 

In the future, Cristina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more food stocks to sell, like canned goods, processed meat, like hot dogs, chicken,  bananas, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is a 49-year-old, married woman and a mother of three grown children, from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place.

Cerelina wants to expand her business, but she lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, mosquito repellent, biscuits, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, among other items. With this loan, she will be able to improve the variety of her stocks, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Cerelina hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, mosquito repellent, biscuits, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, among other items.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi lives in Hovtashat village in the Ararat region. She is an agronomist and keeps a greenhouse where she cultivates greens. Armenuhi lives with her husband, 24-year-old son and mother-in-law. Armenuhi's son and husband sell the gathered harvest in local markets and gather income for family's daily living.

The requested loan of USD 2,000 will be a big support for Armenuhi to renovate the greenhouse. As it is very old and needs to be improved, the loan will greatly help Armenuhi to continue her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Russetta

texts.en:
Meet Russetta, a joyful hardworking farmer living in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of school-going age. She enjoys farming because of the high production she gets. She has been doing it for 16 years. Her primary income source is milk, eggs, tea, maize, and vegetables. Her major challenge is insufficient capital for carrying out her projects.

Russetta chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of their favorable interest rate on their loans. During the training, she learned how to plan and budget every detail of her farming activities. She says that through this loan, she will be able to produce more crops to sell. This will lead to an increase in income.This will enable her to cover her children's school fees and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to plant horticultural crops.

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en:
Vardanush is from Zarinja village. She lives with her husband and three grown up children (ages 23, 24 and 26 years old). The whole family is engaged in agricultural activities. They keep cattle and cultivate wheat and barley. The farm is sustainable and profitable enough for covering the family's daily costs.

The reason Vardanush asks this loan is to enlarge the agribusiness. She plans to use the loan in purchasing 15 oxen, 5 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock (grass, corn). This loan is a big support for Vardanush's farm and her whole family hopes for support.

loans.use: to pay for 15 oxen, 5 piglets and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Wupa

texts.en:
Wupa manages a day care at home. She takes care of five children with warmth and love. Wupa provides an excellent environment for the children in her care. She is recognized by the municipality. The parents are pleased with the care and there is high demand for her day care. 

Wupa needs to make renovations. After there was city-wide work in her yard, areas of her day care were affected and now Wupa is taking the opportunity to make some important upgrades.

Wupa needs this loan to assist in paying for a new partition, plumbing work, flooring, play toys, and work on the outside play area.

Wupa has four grown children of her own and she wants to be able to continue to provide quality care and to help with her grandchildren’s education.

loans.use: to assist in paying for a new partition, plumbing work, flooring, play toys, and work on the outside play area.

loans.name: Wang'ae Group

texts.en:
Mohamedi, who is in his early 20s, is a single father of a small child.  He has been running a library business since 2012.  He works from 8 am to 9 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mohamedi's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He fully repaid his previous ones, which he used to buy up-to-date DVDs and paint the library office. Profits went toward caring for his child and paying household expenses.  Mohamedi will use this loan to buy housing, a telephone charger, movies, tapes and DVDs. He dreams of owning a very big international library, and appreciates Kiva for supporting their group.

Mohamedi will share this loan with his group "WANG'AE" which has 12 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy housing, a telephone charger, movies, tapes and DVDs

loans.name: Cooproriz Isabane Gp 3 Group

texts.en:
Rosette is married to a farmer and they both have seven children. She has been a rice farmer for the past 15 years. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. Rosette is the group leader and has managed to spend many years in this position of leading her group. She is identified as the person holding files in the group photo. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, oil, coal, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Hawa from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is single with one child. Six years ago, Hawa established her local snacks business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to educate her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. Hawa says that her business is doing well.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase more chicken, cooking seasoning and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, cooking seasoning and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: El Amanecer De Callahuanca Group

texts.es: Maria tiene 61 años de edad es conviviente. Ella se dedica a su bodega que implemento e su vivienda y a la vez trabaja en la municipalidad de la zona que radica como servicio de mantenimiento. Años atrás se dedicaba a su chacra. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz azúcar  aceite bebidas y cerveza. Su mayor deseo es comprar una casa en una zona en donde ampliar su negocio. En el grupo “EL AMANECER DE CALLAHUANCA” cumple la función d presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Maria es la segunda persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Maria is 61 years old.  She has set up a store in her home and also does maintenance work in the city where she lives.  Years ago she had a farm.  She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, and beer.  Her greatest desire is to buy a house in an area where she can expand her business.  She serves as the president of the “EL AMANECER DE CALLAHUANCA” group, and the group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Maria is the second person on the left.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es: La señora Hipólita tiene 40 años, casada tiene dos hijos de las edades de 18 y 9 años, se  dedica a la actividad de confección de monederos y billeteras de cuero, tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tupac Katari,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y la  señora Hipólita va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una máquina de coser para incrementar la confección de sus artículos, la señora Hipólita tiene muchos pedidos de sus artículos que tiene que entregar ya que por estas fechas tiene mucha demanda, la señora Hipólita es una persona muy trabajadora tiene ganas de seguir delante de mejorar  su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que tiene para sacar a su hijas adelante ya que ellas estudian.
texts.en:
Hipólita is a married 40-year-old woman with two children, who are ages 9 and 18.  She has a business making leather purses and wallets.  Her shop is located in the area of Tupac Katari.  This is her first loan with the institution, and she will use this loan in order to purchase a sewing machine so that she can increase her production.

She has many orders that she needs to fill, since there is much demand for her goods during this season.  She is a very hardworking person and is motivated to get ahead and improve her family's quality of life.  This is the only income that she has available to support her children to complete their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José es un joven visionario y emprendedor de 21 años de edad, que se dedica a vender productos por catálogo para generar ingresos que le permitan apoyar a la economía de su hogar.
Con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos y prestar un servicio que le hace falta a la comunidad donde reside, quiere comenzar un nuevo proyecto de negocio, un café internet y papelería, el cual trabajará en compañía de su novia, es por ello que se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará computadores, silletería y artículos de papelería, esto le permitirá dar inicio a su idea de negocio, con la que espera generar los recursos necesarios para seguir velando por el bienestar familiar.
José se proyecta para un futuro, teniendo su negocio bien acreditado y que sea reconocido en la zona, para que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable y así poder apoyar a su novia con los estudios universitarios y brindar mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a young visionary and 21 year old entrepreneur who sells products via catalog to generate the income he needs to support his household.

Since he wants to improve his income and provide a necessary service to the community, he wants to start a new business by opening an internet café that he and his girlfriend will work.  He is asking for a loan to buy computers, seats, and paper goods.  This will allow him to start his business, with which he expects to generate the income necessary to continue looking after his family’s wellbeing.

Jose hopes to have a good business in the future that is well known in the area to guarantee favorable financial stability and be able to support his girlfriend with her university studies and also provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy computers, seats, and paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, red oil, and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wigs, shampoo, hair conditioner, etc., for her business

loans.name: Virginia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 20 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado de Educación Básica, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en un bus, tiene una hija que todavía no va a la, y Virginia vive en casa de sus padres.

Virginia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tostadas de plátano en un desvío donde hay estación de buses,  este negocio lo realiza desde hace dos años y aprendió el negocio por su mamá, lo hace desde hace mucho tiempo, antes no salía a vender por que cuidaba a sus hermanos mientras su madre vendía, el lugar donde saca la venta está a 5 minutos de su casa.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar plátano al por mayor, y para elaborar otro tipo de productos, con la ayuda del crédito ella estará cubriendo dichas necesidades.

Los sueños de Virginia son empezar una pequeña empresa de fabricación de tostadas, llegar a convertirse en distribuidora de de los productos que elabora, también desea darle lo necesario a su hija y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is 20 years old and has a fourth grade education.  She is married and her husband has a bus.  She has a daughter who does not attend school yet.  Virginia lives at her parents’ house and has been making and selling tostadas for two years.  She learned this from her mother who has been doing this for a long time.  She didn’t used to go out to sell because she took care of her siblings while her mother sold in a place five minutes from her home.

She needs this loan to buy bananas in quantity so she can make another type of product.

Virginia wants to start a small company to make tostadas, become a distributor, and also provide her daughter what she needs to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Kipawa Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is a mother of five children, three men and two daughters of whom one is in school while the others are grown. She has been engaged with fabrics and sarongs door to door sales business. Sharifa also cooks and sells bites (vitumbua, donuts and chapati) with juice at home. She has been in these businesses for seven years and is able to make a fair monthly profit. Sharifa starts her work from 5am to 10am where she cooks and sells bites. After that, she starts knocking door to door searching customers of her second business and end at 5pm daily. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her twelfth loan request which she will use to rent a place for her bites and juices sales business. She needs to rent a nice place where she can serve more people and later on became a big restaurant. With the previous loans, all of which paid back successfully, she used the funds to restock her business with food cooking ingredients; fruits for making juice, baking flour, rice for making vitumbua and cooking oil. She bought a stock of fabrics and sarongs. With the improvement of her business, Sharifa earned an extra income which she used to buy her own bed, TV and covered part of home food expenses. She is really appreciating Kiva loan support which makes her smile. Sharifa dreams that one day she will be able to improve her family life.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kipawa" which totals two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to rent a place for her bites and juices sales business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco es originario de la comunidad tiguilotada , dice que el aún recuerda que  cuando el comenzó a estudiar la primaria  lo hizo con muchas dificultades  porque la escuela le quedaba bien largo además de la mala  situación económica de sus padres , sus padres siempre fueron bien luchadores  y los ingresos que tenían procuraban  usarlo  en la compra de la comida del hogar para que no faltara ,  así que el con dificultad  logro terminar la escuela primaria por que después se dedicó a trabajar en el campo con su papa . Él  tiene su propia familia   vive con sus esposa  y sus dos hijos los que ya están grandes y con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo los ha sacado adelante, en su hogar no tiene energía eléctrica viven a oscuras ya que a la comunidad no ha llegado la energía convencional, él  quiere aplicar a este préstamo para comprar sistema solar y así instalarlo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is from the community of Tiguilotada.  He reports that he still remembers that when he started elementary school it was very difficult, because the school was far away, and his parents were in a bad financial situation.  His parents always fought hard to make income to be able to provide food for the family and take care of the rest of their needs. Thus, with a great deal off effort he was able to finish primary school, and then he began working in the fields with his father.

He now has his own family.  He lives with his wife and two children, who are already grown up.  With a great deal of effort he has been able to provide them with a better life.  In his home he does not have electricity - they live this way since conventional energy is not yet available in the community.  He wants to use this loan to purchase a solar power system and install it in his home.

loans.use: to purchase a solar power system.

loans.name: Erika Gissela

texts.es:
Erika es una bella joven de 19 años, vive en el barrio Miraflores Alto de la parroquia de Juan Montalvo de la Provincia de Latacunga, es  soltera, tiene una pequeña hija de dos años, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria, luego dejo de estudiar porque tuvo un nuevo record en la vida y ese era el de cuidar a su hija, es de esta manera que ella empezó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades y del nuevo ser que ahora la compaña.
Para Erika no fue nada fácil alejarse del padre de su hija, sufrió mucho pero sin embargo ella lucho para darle lo mejor a su hija y no se dejó vender por el dolor que sentía ella ahora es muy feliz porque Dios y la vida le dio la oportunidad de ver crecer a su hijita y ella sabe que algún dia llegara a ella una persona que la quiera y la valore a ella y a su hija.
Actualmente Erika vive en una  pequeña casa arrendada y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa y cosméticos, a pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella dedica mucho tiempo también a los cuidados de su pequeña hija.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y hoy solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en la compra de mas mercadería ya que tiene pedidos pendientes de entregar y sus ventas han incrementado más y esto ayudará a  mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su hija, dándole la educación que se merece.
Erika agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Erika is a lovely 19 year old young lady who lives in the Miraflores Alto neighborhood of the Juan Montalvo parish within the Latacunga province.  She is single and has a two year old daughter. [Erika] was able to complete high school, thanks to her parents’ effort.  She didn’t continue her education because she had to care for her daughter and so began working at a young age to support her needs.

It was not easy for Erika to distance herself from her daughter’s father.  It was difficult but she struggled to provide the best to her daughter and she didn’t give up from the pain she felt.  Now she is very happy because God and life has provided her the opportunity to raise her daughter and she knows that she will one day meet someone who will love her and value her daughter.

Erika lives in a small rented home and she buys and sells clothing and cosmetics.  Even though she has a job that demands lots of time, she still makes time to care for her daughter.

She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman and is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to fill orders she has to deliver.  Her sales have increased and this will help her improve her quality of life and provide her daughter with the education she deserves.  Erika is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making the growth of her personal and professional life possible.

loans.use: to buy clothing,

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu. She is 32 years old, from Waterloo, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children.  

In 2000, Isatu established her chicken business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to educate her children. She works at the business seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is when there is no ice on the chicken, it will spoil.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cartons of chicken, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Isatu plans to open a shop to sell chicken. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of chicken, to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Lisbon Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her early 50s, is married with three children; two of them are still at school and the other one is still small. She has been running a beauty salon for three years now.  She works from 9 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair range of profit.

This will be Zainabu’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy hair products and cosmetics to sell.  She dreams of becoming successful in life.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group "Lisbon" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair products and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
O Sr Fernando tem 47 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario os 2 sem idade para frequentar escola. Ele è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade actividade esta que exerce a mais de 7 anos, seus produtos vende no seu  estabelecimento commercial em frente de um posto de saude.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade e bebidas (cerveja, refregerante, arroz,bolachas,  caldos, cebola, farrinha de milhoe mais deversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Tem como desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta almentar da sua familia
texts.en:
Fernando is 47 years old and married. He has five children, three of whom attend primary and secondary school and two are below school age. He's an informal trader of products that are household staples, a business he has run for over seven years. He sells his merchandise at his store which is located in front of a health center.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples and also beverages (beer, soft drinks, rice, crackers, broths, onions, cornflour and various other items) so that he can increase turnover in his business.
His challenge is improving his family's living conditions as well as their diet.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples and also beverages (beer, soft drinks, rice, crackers, broths, onions, cornflour and various other items) so that he can increase turnover in his business.

loans.name: Delmy Aracely

texts.es: Delmy tiene 47 años de edad Y  habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 22 años de edad. Delmy es pequeña comerciante de variedad de ropa y calzado. Tiene tres años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a los buenos productos y buenos precios que ofrece ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Delmy desea invertir en el negocio dado que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos y desea seguir apoyando a su familia por mucho más tiempo. Delmy solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa y calzado para la venta.
texts.en: Delmy is 47 years old and lives in a home of her own with her 22 year old daughter and life’s partner.  Delmy is a small merchant of a clothing and shoes.  She has been doing this for three years and thanks to her good quality products, she has many loyal customers.  Delmy wants to invest into her business, given that it’s one of her main sources of income and she wants to continue supporting her family for much longer.  She is asking for this loan through FUSAI to buy clothing and shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, wire, nails and cement) so that he can increase turnover in his business.

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el es radio técnico (reparación de aparatos electrónicos), desde hace varios años posee su negocio en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Carlos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para televisión y equipo de sonido, herramientas, controles, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le deje buenas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 45 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and three children.  He is a technician and repairs electronic equipment.  For several years he has run his business out of his home.  He has many clients due to his good work and low prices.  With what he earns he is able to meet his household expenses.

He is seeking a loan in order to purchase parts for televisions and audio equipment, as well as tools, remote controls and other  items.  This will enable him to continue to keep his business profitable and to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase parts for televisions and audio equipment, as well as tools, remote controls and other  items.

loans.name: Jose Salomon

texts.es: Jose de 55 años de edad  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Don Jose  se dedica a la pesca artesanal, contando con una pequeña lancha y algunas redes para obtener mariscos. Él se ha dedicado prácticamente toda su vida a esta actividad, la cual incluso ahora le permite salir adelante. El solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más redes para pescar, también anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para realizar la pesca diariamente, desea darles una mejor vida a su familia en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Jose is a hardworking and responsible 55-year-old man.  He lives with his wife and four children.  

He makes his living as a fisherman and uses traditional methods.  He has his own small boat and a variety of nets he uses to catch seafood.  He has done this work for practically his entire life, and at the present time it is helping him to get ahead.

He is seeking a loan through INTEGRAL.  This will enable him to have sufficient funds to purchase more fishing nets, along with hooks and other instruments that he needs in order to to his daily work.  He wishes to provide a better life for his family and to be able to give them everything that they need.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hair products, perfume and clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, chicken, cooking seasoning and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, sugar, flour, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, biscuits, pure water and soft drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plantains and oranges for her business.

loans.name: Maria Carmelina's Group

texts.es:
En una pequeña comunidad del Cantón Eloy Alfaro, vive  FURGENCIO, él es agricultor por descendencia y en su comunidad se dedica a la venta de combustible y lubricantes a embarcaciones fluviales y a moradores del pueblo, que utilizan generadores eléctricos y maquinarias agrícolas. Su esposa se dedica a criar aves de corral (pollos, patos, pavos) y cuida de sus 2 hijos varones de 6 y 3 años.
La venta de combustible, es un buen negocio, dice FURGENCIO ya que las estaciones de servicio quedan muy distantes y los moradores prefieren comprarlo en su local.
Con este préstamo FURGENCIO comprara tanques para almacenar y transportar el combustible (gasolina); comprara un extintor para la seguridad del local y además comprara lubricantes y aceites.
La única forma de comunicación que tienen es a través del internet desde la casa comunal y su idioma es autóctono.
FURGENCIO espera en poco tiempo acondicionar mejor el local de su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes y amigos las comodidades, seguridad y mercadería que sus vecinos requieren.

INFORMACION ADICIONAL
FURGENCIO es el líder de la comunidad y del grupo AADAVI, formado por 16 personas 10 hombres y 6 mujeres.  En la fotografía aparece FURGENCIO levantando su mano. 
Hemos tomado la fotografía en los bajos de la oficina ya que la comunidad queda a más de 5 horas desde San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
Furgencio lives in a small community in the canton of Eloy Alfaro.  He comes from a family of farmers, and in his community he sells fuel and oils to boat owners and residents of the village, who are then able to operate farm machinery and also generate electricity.  His wife raises birds such as chickens, ducks and turkeys, and also takes care of their two boys, who are ages 3 and 6.

The sale of fuel is a good business for Furgencio.  He says that gas stations are very far from the village, and the locals prefer to purchase their fuel from him.

With this loan he will buy tanks so that he can store and transport gasoline.  He will also purchase a fire extinguisher for the security of his shop, and also purchase lubricants and oils.  He hopes that soon he will be able to improve the condition of his shop and offer his customers and friends the comforts, security and merchandise that they need.

The only form of communication his family has is through the internet at a communal home in the village, and they speak the Autoctono language.

He is also the leader of his community and the head of the group AADAVI, which is comprised of ten men and six women.  In the photograph Furgencio can be seen raising his hand.  The photo was taken beneath the office, since the village is more than five hours from San Lorenzo.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, tanks, oil, lubricants and a fire extinguisher.

loans.name: Glenda Guadalupe

texts.es: Glenda tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 6 años y 8 meses de edad. Glenda se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos como: papas fritas, empanadas, yuca frita, etc. La venta la realiza desde hace más de 2 años y es así como junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. GLenda desea terminar de construir un cuarto en su terreno el cual no ha logrado terminar por falta de recursos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, alambre, pines y polines.
texts.en: Glenda is 28 years old. She lives at home with her life partner and her 6 and 8-month old children. Glenda sells traditional snacks such as potato chips, empanadas, fried yucca, etc. She has done this for over 2 years so that her and her partner can pay for the household expenses. Glenda wants to finish building a room on her property which she had been unable to complete due to a lack of resources. Therefore, she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wires, pins, and poles.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wires, pins, and poles.

loans.name: San Martín De Porres Group

texts.es: Wilfredo pertenece al grupo”San Martín de Porres” casado tiene tres hijos se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  donde su familia lo apoyan desde muy temprano trabajan 11 horas diarias, en el negocio lleva 12 años aproximadamente, en este rubro lo que más le gusta es que está permanentemente en contacto con la gente, atiende aproximadamente a mas de 50 clientes diarios, el préstamo que adquirió de EDAPROSPO lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería como pañales, aceite, arroz ,leche y demás y así poder surtir mas su negocio. Agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por todo el apoyo que reciben. “Muchas gracias KIVA no se arrepentirán por la ayuda que nos dan, por que será para bien”.
texts.en:
Wilfredo belongs to the “San Martín de Porres” group.  He is married and has three children.  He sells groceries, and his family helps him.  He starts very early, and he works 11 hours a day.  He has had the business for approximately 12 years.  What he likes best about this line of work is that he is constantly in contact with people.  He tends to more or less 50 customers a day.

He will use the loan from EDAPROSPO to buy more merchandise like diapers, cooking oil, rice, milk, and more.  This way he will be able to stock his business more.  He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for all of the support received.  “Thanks you very much Kiva.  You will not be sorry for the help that you give us because it will used for good.”

loans.use: to buy stock for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. She began this business to be self-independent and take care of her family.  

Kadiatu runs a retail business; she sells charcoal. She has been running this business for fifteen years. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. 

In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Jenoveba Rosales

texts.es: Jenoveba tiene tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 17 años, 14 años y 11 años de edad. Jenoveba es una mujer muy trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo va saliendo adelante.  Ella desea construir el techo del corredor de la vivienda y encementar el piso dado que actualmente es de tierra. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines, cemento, arena y grava. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Jenoveba is 52 years old and she lives in her own home with her 3 children who are 17, 14 and 11 years old. Jenoveba is a very hard-working woman who, with a lot of sacrifice, continues to move forward. She hopes to put up the ceiling of the hallway in her home and cement the floor seeing as it is currently made of dirt. 

She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to spend on purchasing zinc-coated sheet metal, poles, cement, sand and gravel. She hopes she can depend on this support to be able to improve the living conditions of her and her family.

loans.use: to buy zinc-coated sheet metal, poles, cement, sand and gravel to repair the hallway ceiling and to cement the floor in the home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dried bush meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, cement, rebar, sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Maximina Estela

texts.es:
Maximina es una humilde mujer de 62 años, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia y desde hace 13 años trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida con el cual puede salir adelante  y solventar los gastos de su hogar; Maximina puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ya que su ciudad es muy visitada por los turistas y puede trabajar hasta 10 horas al día.

Maximina esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá implementar mejor su negocio y sobre todo comprar utensilios como platos, cubiertos, entre otros y de esta manera poder atender mejor a sus clientes y seguir esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Maximina is a humble, 62 year old woman. She lives in the city of Aguaytia and for 13 years she has worked in her small food business, which has allowed her to get ahead and provide for her household expenses. Maximina usually tends to up to 15 customers per day because the city is frequented by many tourists and she can work up to 10 hours per day.

Maximina is grateful to the Kiva lenders because it’s thanks to the help they have provided that she will be able to improve her business and buy items such as plates and silverware, among other things. In this way, she will be able to take better care of her customers and continue working hard to make her biggest dream into a reality: “To have a bigger business.”

loans.use: to improve her business by buying utensils for serving food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, and other necessary products.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois courant deuxième semestre 2013. Ce groupe est composé de femmes très dynamiques qui partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide été elles vivent dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 garçon et 01 fille. C’est une femme très déterminée à faire prospérer ses activités génératrices de revenu. Elle tient dans sa maison deux frigos où elle commercialise de la glace des jus de fruits à base de produits locaux et de la crème glacée pour les enfants du quartier.  

Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter deux sacs de 50 kg de pain de singe, des feuilles de bissap, du sucre et divers colorants alimentaires pour la préparation des jus.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner d’une part pour accroître sa capacité de financement et d’apporter son  soutien à son marie dans gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group, created during the second semester of 2013, at the same time as the Banc Villageois, is made up of some very dynamic women who share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance.  The members of the group have been living in the same neighborhood for several years and are mainly involved in small retail business.

Binta is the group's featured borrower.  In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the right.  She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of two children (a boy and a girl).  She is a very determined woman who is eager to see her income-generating activities thrive.  She owns two refrigerators at home, in which she stores ice, fruit juices made from local products, as well as ice cream for the local children.

She plans to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of baobab fruits, some hibiscus leaves, some sugar and various food coloring products to make juices.

She will use the profits from her business to save some money and increase her financing capacity, and also to support her husband with the management of the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy two 50-kilo bags of baobab fruits, some hibiscus leaves, sugar and food coloring products to make juices.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 3 children. Fatmata established her local snacks business 5 years ago because she wanted to create income to educate her children. She works at the business 6 days per week, from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. She says that her business is doing well and provides her with income to take care of her children.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more fruit and gari (cassava flakes) to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and to increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Flor De Cña Tiritibol Group

texts.es:
La señora gladis de estado civil casada. De 38 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 3 hijos y 1 de ellos está estudiando. Se dedica a la siembra de Cardamomo y Café. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital propio y a la fecha lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para el mantenimiento de Cardamomo y café. En el futuro desea tener mas terreno para poder sembrar mas cardamomo y café. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de cardamomo.
texts.en:
Gladis is 38 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has three children and one of them is studying. She makes a living by growing cardamom and coffee. She began this business with a small amount of her own capital and now has 15 years of experience.

She organises a group and she is requesting a loan, which she will use to maintain her cardamom and coffee crops. In the future she wants to have more land in order to sow more cardamom and coffee. 

The other members of the group make a living by growing cardamom.

loans.use: to buy compost for her cardamom and coffee crops

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
Neri tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el Caserío El Sondor, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una zona de calor, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para al compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Neri is 32 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the small town of El Sondor, a rural area in the district of Pomahuaca. It is a place that is warm and the population works in agriculture, commerce, and cattle. It’s located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He and his wife work in agriculture, especially in coffee farming. They are a strong, unified family and they work hard. He has requested a loan of 1,000.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor in order to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor in order to maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Yulisa Rosa

texts.es:
