Yulisa tiene 22 años, vive en el distrito de Santiago, y desde hace un año trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y ello le permite poder tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su menor hijo de 1 añito, con apoyo de su esposo.

Yulisa esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cama para su bebé y de esta manera poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y podrá seguir esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida a su hijo y poder darle una buena educación”.
texts.en:
Yulisa is 22 years old. She lives in the district of Santiago, and she has worked for a year as a field worker on an estate in her city. She works about 9 hours a day, and this allows her to have income to raise her young son, who is one year old, with the help of her husband.

Yulisa is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have offered her, she sill be able to buy a bed for her baby and in this way be able to offer him a better quality of life, and she will be able to continue striving to make a reality of her great dream: to give a good quality of life to her son and be able to give him a good education.

loans.use: to buy a bed for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal and crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, onions, etc. for her business

loans.name: Yuvixa Soledad

texts.es:
Yuvixa tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche de tollo y caballa así como chicha de jora., su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace varios años para apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de insumos como pescados, sacos de maíz y azúcar para la elaboración de chicha de jora, asi como también vajilla para servir sus preparos y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yuvixa is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Pucará, which has a warm climate. The people of Pucará make a living from agriculture, trade, and ranching. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Yuvixa makes a living by selling shark and mackerel ceviche as well as chicha de jora (corn beer). Her business is located in her home. She has been doing this work for several years in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN so she can buy a variety of supplies, such as fish and sacks of maize and sugar for making chicha de jora, as well as dishes for serving her food. This will help her business to grow and generate greater earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy dishes and supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Wilder Estamislao

texts.es:
Wilder Estamislao tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte publico, en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a su pasajeros a las zonas aledañas a su distrito, cuenta con clientela en su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglos de su movilidad y arreglos de su vivienda y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilder Estamislao is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucara, a community with a very warm climate. The population works in agriculture, commerce, and cattle. It’s located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He provides public transportation in his own motorcycle taxi. He carries passengers to nearby areas in his district. He has customers in his district. He has requested a loan of 1,000.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to make repairs to his vehicle and to fix some things in his house. In this way he will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his vehicle and to make some repairs to his house.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, comercio de animales menores, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Petronita is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of La Matanza, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located in the province of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells chicha de jora [a corn beer made with Jora corn from the Andes] and beer. Her business is located in her home. She also sells small animals. She is an entrepreneurial mother. She has applied for a loan of 3000 PEN to buy a greater quantity of beer in order to make her business grow and in this way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beer to offer her customers.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy tiene 42 años de edad y vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de limpieza hace 2 años en una empresa de su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales como cemento y pago de mano de obra por el arreglo del piso de su vivienda y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Percy is 42 years old. He lives in his own house, made of rustic materials, along with his wife and children, in the district of Pucara. The community has a warm climate and the population works in agriculture, commerce, and cattle. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has been providing cleaning services for a business in his community for 2 years. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to buy materials such as cement and to pay for labor in order to fix the floor of his house. In this way, he will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement and to pay for labor in order to fix the floor of his house.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe, whose name in Albanian means ‘white’,  is dressed in black because she is still grieving after her 28-year-old son drowned 7 months ago while he was digging a well for pay in a village far from his home. “I cannot stop crying; I feel guilt, I feel remorse, I feel all these terrible things,” said Bardhe during her interview.

Bardhe is a married mother of seven children who, until a year ago, lived with one of her married sons in Greece.  As soon as she arrived back to her native village, she bought two sheep, one goat and the two cows you see in the picture. She wants to use this loan to further expand her livestock activity by adding one more cow and repairing the existing stable.

loans.use: to add one more cow and to repair the stable

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, patos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, se dedica a esta labor para apoyar con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de animales y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos.
texts.en:
Fanny is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotún, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and cattle. It’s located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru.

She raises and sells animals: roosters, hens, chicks, turkeys, and ducks. Her business is located behinder her house. She does this work in order to help with the family’s expenses. She has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to buy a variety of animals and balanced feeds for fattening them.

loans.use: to buy a variety of animals and balanced feeds for fattening them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment for his dairy farm

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
This is Emine, a 54-year-old married mother of two, who’s been photographed with her horse that she uses for transportation. Many villagers in this southeastern region use horses for transportation, whereas in other regions donkeys are the most used for such a purpose.

Emine does agriculture/livestock for a living. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) to add a dairy cow to her existing herd. She works very hard because her husband has some health problems with his legs and he uses walking sticks in both of his hands.

A bit about Emine’s village: it’s a very hilly countryside and, for this reason, livestock is the most preferred activity among the locals. However, they don’t limit themselves to the planting and harvesting of wheat, animal fodder and dried pinto and lima beans. Pickled white cabbage, tomatoes, peppers and stuffed peppers with cottage cheese are their staple winter foods.

loans.use: to add a dairy cow to her existing herd

loans.name: Beqir

texts.en:
This is Beqir with his goats and their babies inside the stable that he wants to repair. Besides these animals, he’s also got two dairy cows, five sheep, walnuts, plum orchards and grapevines. 

Beqir is a rural villager who lives in the south-central part of the country, not far from the major city of Elbasan. He sells several products at the farmer’s market: jam that he and his wife make out of the fresh walnuts, compote made of plums and red wine made primitively out of his own grapevines. They also sell animal products such as 0.5 % low-fat cow cottage cheese and ‘the most wanted cheese’ amongst the majority of Albanian residents, full-fat and unsalted goat cheese. Note here that some people eat the goat cheese with sugar or honey or syrup.

loans.use: to repair the existing stable

loans.name: Donald Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Donald Rogelio, tiene 52 años de edad y habita en el barrio Memoreal Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, junto a su emprendedora esposa han procreado dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad y con independencia familiar. Don Donald trabaja por cuenta propia y a pesar que no ha poseído un trabajo permanente en el área de de construcción ha logrado llevar a cabo planes de desarrollo para su vivienda. Él solicita su noveno crédito con el que mejorará las condiciones de la misma que es de suma prioridad debido a la inseguridad del barrio, el crédito le permitirá levantar la pared trasera que conforma la tapia de su casa, por lo cual necesita comprar materiales de construcción tales como bloques, cemento, hierro y arena.
texts.en:
Donald Rogelio is 52 years old and he lives in the neighborhood of Memoreal Sandino in Managua city with his entrepreneurial wife. They have two children, both are adults and are independent from the family. Donald is self-employed and despite not having a permanent job in the construction field, he has managed to carry out plans to improve his home. 

He is requesting his ninth loan with which he will improve the conditions of the house which is a huge priority due to the unsafe neighborhood. The loan will allow him to put up a rear wall that forms the boundary wall to his house, for which he needs to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, iron and sand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, iron and sand.

loans.name: Sire's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé  le 02 Décembre 2002  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de   femmes très attachées au culte du travail, elles jouissent d’une très bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même Village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et pratiquent aussi l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Siré (debout à droite avec une main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50 ans et mère de 06 enfants dont 2 filles et 04 garçons. C’est une femme très engagée dans le développement de banc villageois. Elle fabrique le savon traditionnel à partir de l’huile et de l’acide savonneux, elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus d’une décennie.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’avoir deux bidons d’huile 15 000 F CFA L’un, 05 kg d’acide savonneux pour    1 000 F CFA le kilo et divers produits entrant dans la fabrication du savon.

Les bénéfices lui serviront de participer significativement aux frais scolaire de ses enfants et à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 2, 2002, on the same day the village's lending group was inaugurated. It is made up of women who are very dedicated to the value of work. They benefit from a very good experience in the lending group system. They are all from the same village. Their main activity is retail; they also grow crops in the rainy season.

Mrs. Siré (standing to the right with her right hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is 50 years old and a mother of six, two girls and four boys. She is very involved in developing village lending groups. She manufactures traditional soap from oil and soap-making acid. She benefits from a good amount of experience in this domain, having been in it for over ten years.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase two cans of oil (15,000 XOF each) and five kilos of soap-making acid (1,000 XOF per kilo), as well as various products used to manufacture soap.

Profits will allow her to make a difference in supporting her children with school fees and to pay for daily expenses.

loans.use: to buys two cans of oil (15,000 XOF each), five kilos of acid for soap making (1,000 XOF a kilo) and various other products to manufacture soap.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Charles works hard to support his family.

He has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Charles is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of his motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

Charles has been sustaining his business activities through his past 14 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is single and has a dry goods vending  business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rexhep

texts.en:
This is Rexhep being photographed inside his rundown family house; he wants to repair it with your financial help through the loan that he is requesting from Kiva lenders. He is a married father of two teen-aged children.

Rexhep is a farmer who works for pay; in addition to this income, he sells red wine and the "raki" drink (made from his grapes) to locals  and also sells raw milk and homemade 0-0.5 % low fat cottage cheese.

Rexhep’s co-villagers plant in quantities rye, oats, onions, corn, and garlic. They then sell the products to the wholesale buyers. Corn bread and stuffed peppers with cottage cheese are the most used ones amongst the villagers.

loans.use: to repair his rundown home

loans.name: Faik

texts.en:
Faik lives under bad conditions due to the fact that his family home is very old and not maintained properly. All of his family are afraid that their house will collapse soon should it not be repaired quickly. 

Faik has one dairy cow and three sheep from a good breed that produce more milk compared to other breeds of sheep. He’s also got grapevines and plants in large quantities, beans mainly, to dry for winter. Faik and his family live in a village where the winters are long and the weather is extremely cold. The drinking water comes from natural resources. Villagers here are known for their hospitality.

loans.use: to repair his rundown family home

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en:
Fatmir wants to invest in a mini school bus, similar to the one shown in the picture. He got a recent contract from the Ministry of Education to transport teachers and school children. Usually 99% of teachers who teach in the rural areas are city residents; thus, they’ve got to travel every day approximately 3-4 hours both ways.  Children are required to travel, as well, since, for most of them, school is located far from their village. Some children don’t even make it to school, unfortunately, due to the lack of funds; they have to pay for such expenses out of pocket.
 
Except for this business, Fatmir and his wife own plenty of plum orchards and sell the fruit to wholesalers.

loans.use: to invest in a mini school bus

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living through her retail sales of grocery cards, or purchase order cards, which are used for purchasing groceries and other goods in specific supermarkets in town.

As of now, Sharon is asking for a loan to purchase more grocery cards. With this, she will be able to sell more cards to her customers. In the future, Sharon hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, Sharon wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery cards

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is a 39-year-old married woman and a  mother of two children ages 9 and 4. She lives with her family in the town of Talibon, Bohol. Analou runs a  sari-sari or retail store business selling a different variety of goods and items ranging from food products to toiletries. Analou has been in the business for more than five years now. 

Analou is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, coffee, sugar, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her stocks which allows her to cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Analou hopes to make her business a sustainable source of income so that she can continue in supporting the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 17 years. Carol has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Carol has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan loan to further build her general store business. In the future, Carol would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita is 37 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Elsita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira, 33 years old, is married and has four children. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending. Elvira is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Donal tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluros, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno en las invernas que están ubicadas a 20 minutos de su distrito, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ordeñando el ganado lechero para posteriormente ofrecer la leche fresca y venta de quesillos, son una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno tierno para luego engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Donald is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucará, a community with a hot climate. Its people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He raises and sells beef cattle in Las Invernas, which is located 20 minutes from his district. His wife helps him with this work, milking the milk cow to later offer fresh milk and make cheese to sell. They are a united family. He has applied for a loan of 3000 PEN to buy young cattle to fatten and then offer for sale at a better price.

loans.use: to buy young beef cattle to fatten and then offer at a better price.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of a grown son. Leonida has been selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Leonida is asking for a loan to buy more stock, such as biscuits, chips, noodles, canned goods, soap, toiletries, mosquito repellent, etc. to sell. With this, Leonida will  be able to improve the variety of her stock, which will attract more customers to her store. Leonida is hopeful that she can expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Ermildo

texts.es:
Ermildo tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2501 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ermildo is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Colasay, a community with a varied climate and a population engaged in farming, trade and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

Ermildo is a farmer, specifically of coffee. His wife helps him with the work. He has requested a loan of S/.2501 to purchase compost and pay for day laborers who will help maintain his coffee crops. Thus he will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and pay for day laborers who will help maintain his coffee plants.

loans.name: Segundo Cesar

texts.es:
Segundo Cesar tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios de construcción civil, es conocido en su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender mayores necesidades en el ámbito de la construcción.
texts.en:
Segundo Cesar is 63 years old and lives with his wife in the Cayaltí district, located in the Province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people here in this hot climate work in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle.

Segundo provides construction services and is well-known in his district. He has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy tools. This investment will help him undertake bigger projects in the construction field.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a soft drinks and beer dealer business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks and beer to sell for her soft drinks and beer dealer business.

Evangeline has been in this business for ten years. Evangeline earns more income from general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks and beer to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Evelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea, 32 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in the rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Rice farming and corn planting are the family's main sources of income. Sophea has been in this business for 10 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sophea’s group consists of two female members, both living in the same village. Sophea is on her sixth loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her portion of this loan to buy seeds and for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and for her farmland

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 58, married, and has five adult children. He is raising his family in a rural community and earns a living through farming. Aside from farming, he also engages in a hog-raising business to have an additional source of income.

Rogelio wants to acquire more piglets to raise, but he has limited capital. For this reason, he would like a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy piglets, feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. With patience and hard work, he believes that he will improve his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising

location.town: Brgy. Canabay, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 60, is a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is a widow and mother. She and her children manage their own household. Virginia continually works hard to provide income for the family's everyday expenses.  

Virginia oversees and owns their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The driver remits a boundary (daily quota) to Virginia, who earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Virginia is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of their tricycle.

Virginia hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of corn and sugar for the preparation of chicha de jora (a corn based beer).

loans.name: Karina Maribel

texts.es:
Karina Maribel tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de maíz para la preparación de chicha de jora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de maíz amarillo y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Karina Maribel is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the La Matanza district, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located in the province of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells corn for preparing chicha de jora [a corn-based beer made from Jora corn from the Andes]. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN to buy a larger quantity of yellow corn and in this way offer it at a better price, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of yellow corn to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Florita has been in this business for 11 years now.

Florita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Florita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Liz

texts.en:
Ma. Liz, 38 years old, is married and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 25 years, Ma. Liz has run a general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a bakery and selling meat and fish. 

Ma. Liz has requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, feed, rice, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell. Ma. Liz has previously borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, feed, rice, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Milton Daniel

texts.es:
Milton Daniel tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace más de seis años, Milton ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milton Daniel is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Nueva Arica district. Its people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Together with his wife, he has been raising and selling animals such as roosters, hens, and chickens for more than six years. Milton has applied for a loan of 2000 PEN to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals and offer them to his customers at a better price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her earnings were a big help in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Gemma would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more raw materials such as fabric, thread, etc. for her business. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gemma hopes to have more customers and dreams of giving her children a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more raw materials such as fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa, 55 years old, is married and has eleven children, five of them still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past 2 years, Ma. Luisa has operated a business selling meat and frozen foods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods and meat to sell. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods and meat to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 37 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. For the past 3 years, Maricel has operated an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has previously borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 10 years. 

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her hog raising business, thus augmenting her sales and income. Zenaida dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the family's needs, such as food and paying the bills.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta de estación, lo comercializa en su domicilio, sus clientes en la mayoría son los transportistas y vecinos, también se dedica a la venta de animales menores , ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales.
texts.en:
Santos is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and children in Pucará District located in the Province of Jaén in Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. The people here in this hot climate work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Santos sells seasonal fruits from her house. Her clients for the most part are neighbors and drivers. She also sells small animals She has requested a loan of 4,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a variety of fruit to offer to her clients. She will use a second part to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to offer to her clients.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 40 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Mary Ann has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from food vending. 

Mary Ann has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has previously borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. Mary Ann aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita, 49 years old, is widowed and has seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 4 years, Miguelita has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as soft drinks, detergent, soap, toothpaste, eggs, etc. 

Miguelita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as soft drinks, detergent, soap, toothpaste, eggs, etc. to sell. In the future, Miguelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as soft drinks, detergent, soap, toothpaste, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza, 27 years old, is married and has two children. For the past 5 years, Monaliza has operated a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Monaliza has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business. Monaliza would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Robert works hard to support his family. He has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood. Robert is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Robert has successfully repaid his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his fish vending business. He has been sustaining his business activities through his past 18 loans from NWTF. Robert hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of saving enough money to afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 25 years, she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosario has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Rosario would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.es:
NELLY, es madre soltera, su hija tiene 12 años y asiste normalmente a la escuela.
Nelly tiene 33 años y desde muy temprana edad se dedica a prestar servicios en su gabinete de belleza.
Ella tiene su gabinete en una casa que arrienda en el centro de un pueblo al norte de Esmeraldas en la misma que habita desde hace 10 años. Ella necesita este préstamo para la compra de accesorios como: cremas, desodorantes, tintes, alisadoras, tratamientos capilares, extensiones.
Tiene el deseo de crecer en su negocio, dar trabajo a jóvenes que les guste el estilismo, comprar su propia casa para poner su negocio y vivir con su hija.
La comunidad donde habita, es muy vulnerable, la gente vive de la agricultura que difícilmente pueden sacar al mercado. NELLY es nueva en el grupo “UNIDOS VENCEREMOS” y sus compañeras y compañeros la eligieron líder del grupo por su compromiso de trabajo, dedicación en las tareas a realizar. 
INFORMACION ADICIONAL
El grupo se conforma por 8 mujeres y 2 hombres, 4 de sus integrantes reciben $500  y 6 de ellos reciben $ 700 dólares por ser la segunda vez que realizan el préstamo.  NELLY levanta su mano en la fotografía.
texts.en:
Nelly is a single mother. Her daughter is 12 years old and normally attends school.
Nelly is 33 years old and has been in beauty services for a living from a very young age.
She has her beauty shop in a house that she rents in the center of town north of Esmeraldas, in the same house she has lived in for 10 years. She needs this loan to buy accessories like creams, deodorants, dye, relaxers, hair treatments, and extensions.
She wants to grow her business, give work to young people that like hair styling, and buy her own house for her business and to live in with her daughter. The community where she lives is very vulnerable. The people live from agriculture that is difficult to take to market. Nelly is new in the group "Unidos Venceremos" or "United We Overcome" and her companions elected her leader of the group for her work commitment and dedication to the tasks.

Additional Information
The group is made up of 8 women and 2 men. Four of the members receive $500 and six of them receive $700 since it is their second time taking a loan. Nelly is raising her hand in the photo.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, dyes, relaxer, hair treatments.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda is 50 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 22 years, Rosenda has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro, 59 years old, is married and has six children, four of them currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past 3 years, Socorro has operated a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods to sell. In the future, Socorro would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 55 years old, is widowed and has ten children.  For the past 4 years, Susan has operated a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Susan has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business. Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of a grown daughter from Talibon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari, or convenience store, business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. 

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy more stock, such as canned goods, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, candies and biscuits, to sell. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock to display and sell, which will attract more customers. In the future, Zenaida hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia  is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 7 years, she has operated a general store business in the Philippines. Antonia has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Antonia has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Es una mujer sociable y alegre, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 4 son varones: 24 y 21 años de edad ambos independientes, el varón de 19 años estudia su primer año de docencia y el de 13 de años de edad está cursando su primer año de secundaria. De las 3 mujeres, la mayor de 18 años estudia su primer año de medicina en una universidad del Municipio de Puerto Cabezas, la de 14 años cursa su quinto año de secundaria y la menor de 5 años de edad está en tercer nivel de pre-escolar. Su esposo carece de un empleo formal, es soldador. Con el objetivo de contar con una fuente de ingresos solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar ropa usada: una paca de sabana, una paca de ropa mixta y perfumes en Managua y venderlos a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas y ofrecer cosmético por catálogos, sus productos los  vende por encargo y en periodo de veda de la langosta viaja a los Cayos Miskitos para comprar el producto y ofertarla a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas, con las ganancias percibidas hace dos años inicio la construcción de la estructura de su vivienda de concreto, con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento y vivir de manera segura.  Desde hace 12 años vive en una pequeña casa de tambo de madera, la cual solo tiene 2 cuartos y habitan 9 personas. Su  sueño es contar con una vivienda que le brinde las comodidades a su familia, instalarle el techo, compactar el suelo para construir el piso,  instaurarle las ventanas, puertas, verjas, realizar las divisiones de 4 cuartos, construir la cocina y fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en estado regular.
texts.en:
This is a friendly and happy woman. She is 47 years old. She is married and has 7 children, of whom 4 are sons: 24 and 21 years old, both independent; the 19-year-old son is studying in his first year of teaching, and the 13-year-old is in his first year of secondary school. Of the 3 daughters, the oldest, who is 18, is studying in her first year of medicine in a university in the community of Puerto Cabezas; the 14-year-old is in her 5th year of secondary school, and the youngest, who is 5 years old, is in the third level of preschool. Her husband does not have a formal job. He is a welder. 

With the goal of having a source of income, she is applying for her second loan to buy used clothing (a bale of sheets and a bale of mixed clothing) and perfumes from Managua. She will sell them at affordable prices in Puerto Cabezas and offer cosmetics through catalogs. She sells her products through orders, and in lobster season she travels to Cayos Miskitos to buy this product and offer it at affordable prices in Puerto Cabezas. With the earnings she received two years ago, she began the construction of the concrete structure of her house with the goal of reducing the overcrowding and living securely. For twelve years she lived in a little wooden stilt house that had only two rooms and housed 9 people. Her dream is to have a home that offers comfort to her family, install the roof, compact the ground to construct the floor, put in the windows, doors, and fences, make the divisions into four rooms, and build the kitchen and septic tank, since now she has a latrine in average condition.

loans.use: to buy used clothing (a bale of sheets and a bale of mixed clothing) and perfumes in Managua to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a clean cooking gas package in order to improve the cleanliness of her house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with seven children. She is 31 years old and four of her children are currently in school. Grace is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for five years.

Grace requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to purchase additional equipment and tools for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools for her vulcanizing business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, dried fish, etc. to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from videoke machine rentals and food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Grace aspires to save enough money to renovate her store.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, dried fish, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juliana has been in this business for 29 years now.

Juliana requested a PHP 18,000 loan from NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling business in the Philippines. Through her business, she sells Avon products.

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional Avon products to sell to her customers through her direct-selling business.

Editha has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.

Editha has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg, 47 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been teaching kindergarten for more than twenty years. Her husband is a driver and works at a private firm. Their son will soon marry and live separately. 

Altantsetseg is requesting a loan of $400 USD to print her book for teachers. Due to her extensive teaching experience in kindergarten, she began writing a textbook in the early 2000s. Now only the printing work remains and, after this, she will sell her books to potential future teachers. This book is about how teachers should motivate, teach, and befriend preschool children.

loans.use: to print the teaching textbook she has written

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru:
Амриддин житель города Худжанд. Ему 33 года. Он живет с женой, дочерью и сыном, а также с родителями, двумя братьями и двумя племянниками. У него большая семья. Его дочери 8 лет, а сыну 10 лет и они посещают школу. А жена домохозяйка. Амриддин зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услугу такси. В городе его услуга всегда востребована. Он занимается данной деятельностью на протяжении 10 лет. 
Амриддин сейчас хочет помочь своей семье. Дело в том, что один его младший брат является студентом. Он учится в втором курсе Государственного Университета Права, Бизнеса и Политики Таджикистан. Он умный и усердный молодой человек и в будущем хочет стать профессиональным юристом. Так как каждый год цена за обучение в университете повышается, семья Амриддина решила произвести предоплату за оставшееся трехлетнее обучение. В связи с этим Амриддин обратился за кредитом и обязательство по выплате кредита взял на себя. Он по себе знает как трудно найти достойную работу без высшего образования и поэтому хочет помочь брату закончить университет. Амриддину и его семье этот кредит очень важен.
texts.en:
Amriddin lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 33 and lives with his wife, daughter and son, as well as with his parents, two brothers and two nephews.  He has a large family.  His daughter is 8, his son is 10, and both are in grade school.  Amriddin works as a taxi driver, and his wife tends to their home.  There's a lot of demand for taxi drivers in Khujand; Amriddin has earned his living as one for 10 years already.  

At the moment, Amriddin is seeking to help his family.  Specifically, he wants to help his younger brother, who's a university student in his second year at Tajikistan State University of Law, Business, & Politics.  His brother is a smart and motivated young man who hopes to use his degree to work in the judicial system.  Because the price of a university education keeps going up with each passing year, Amriddin's family has decided to pay for his brother's last three years of tuition in advance.  Amriddin has decided to shift the financial burden of this payment onto himself, and is requesting a loan to pay for his brother's tuition.  This loan is crucial for Amriddin and his family.  He knows firsthand how hard it is to find a good job without a university degree, and, as such, wants nothing more than to help his brother graduate.

loans.use: pay tuition for his younger brother's final three years at university

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is a married woman with six children. She is 60 years old and one of her children is still in school. Leoncia is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 20 years.

Leoncia requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is 39 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Ma. Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Ma. Lorena has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
Jose vive en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, ha logrado estudiar para el manejo de maquinaria pesada y actualmente está estudiando para ser director técnico de u  equipo e Fútbol, ya que el fútbol es una de sus pasiones. Para poder tener ingresos para salir adelante trabaja en un almacén de una empresa molinera de su ciudad y también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos agrícolas con lo cual tiene un dinero extra desde hace un año.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar productos agrícolas para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes y de esta manera tener más ingresos para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir esforzando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Hacer crecer su negocio y convertirse en un gran empresario”.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the city of Ferreñafe and he really wants to get ahead. He has managed to study the operation of heavy machinery and he is currently studying to be the coach of a soccer team, since soccer is one of his passions. In order to be able to have an income to get ahead, he works in a warehouse of a milling company from his city. He also has a small store that sells agricultural products from which he has made extra money for a year.

Jose is grateful for the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy agricultural products to offer to his clients. This way he will have more income to improve his quality of life and continue to make an effort to turn his big dream into a reality: to make his business grow and convert himself into a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 39 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Rowena works in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Rowena has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anabel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anabel has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a 25-year-old married man and a father of a one-year-old child from Talibon, Bohol. Wilfredo is tricycle driver and has been in the business for almost five years now. This is the source of his income.

Wilfredo needs a loan for the improvement of his business. He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts like a wheel, tire, nuts and bolts, and chains and to pay for the repair of his tricycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of his tricycle, thus allowing him to transport passengers. In the future, Wilfredo hope to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like a wheel, tire, nuts and bolts, chains and to pay for the repair

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en:
Shiela Mae is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for three years now.

Shiela Mae requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 64 years old and widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Fe has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 51 years old and married with three children. Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, sugar, cereals, milk, detergent, etc. to resell. Lilia has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending. Lilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, sugar, cereals, milk, detergent, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell dried fish business.  Evelyn is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business. Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bibiana is 43 years old and her five children are in school.

Bibiana has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bibiana has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Bibiana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melogen

texts.en:
Melogen works hard to support her family. Melogen is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Melogen requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Melogen has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Melogen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en: Lyn is 43 years old, married and has four children, one who is still in school. Lyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business. Lyn has been in the pig fattening business for 25 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Lyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Brigida is 49 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Brigida requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Brigida has been in this business for four years. In the future, Brigida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Faiilefa

texts.en:
Faiilefa is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling local foods in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

She also grows a vegetable garden as a side business to help with her food ingredients. Faiilefa has requested a loan to buy a gas stove, rice cooker, wok, sacks of flour and sugar, gas, glad wrap, spades, fertilizers, chemicals, and vegetable seeds. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. Her earnings will help her meet the needs for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove, rice cooker, wok, sacks of flour and sugar, gas, glad wrap, spades, fertilizers, chemicals, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Antequera Group

texts.es:
Antequera es un grupo nuevo, está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité, donde además todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Maria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, donde ella pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, ya que es cocinera y por medio de ese trabajo está luchando. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, y demás insumos, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Antequera is a new group. They are in their second loan cycle. Also, they are all taking the poverty elimination survey in order to understand everyone's situation. 
Maria is a member of this group. She is trying hard  to improve her and her families living situation. 

She sells food she herself prepares since she is a cook and through this work is fighting. 

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in buying vegetables, meat, spices and other supplies and in this way keep fighting to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, spices and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit, sugar, rice and meat.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca works hard to support her family. Francisca is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Francisca requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and ingredients for her food vending business. Francisca has been in this business for 20 years now. Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rechel is borrowing PHP 17,500 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Rechel has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Velez

texts.en:
Velez is 34 years old and married with one child. Velez works very hard to provide for them.

Velez runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Velez has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, shampoo, coffee, sugar, milk, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Velez would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene sus esperanzas puestas en mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rumilda, quien se dedica a la venta de helados de variados sabores y de muy buena calidad, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que siempre ofrece muy buena variedad de productos. Su sueño es poder tener una gran heladería, que le permitirá seguir creciendo en su microemprendimiento.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados, y de esa forma seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group called San Cayetano is in its first loan cycle in the women's communal bank program. It is a new group, that has their hopes set on improving their living conditions. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, in which three of them are under the poverty line.

One of the members is Romilda, who sells ice cream of various flavors and of very good quality. She says she has acquired a very good clientele as she always offers a very good variety of products.

Her dream is to be able to have a large ice cream store, which will allow her to continue growing with her small business. She is requesting this loan so that she can use it to buy ice cream, and that way continue working and striving to improve each day.

loans.use: To buy ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Renacer, y forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liliana, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir, está en una situación media, luchando por mejorar sus vidas. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace venta de bijouteries y,  que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bijouteries para la venta, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Renacer" or Revival, and is part of the program of poverty eradication, such that the group is struggling to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Ms. Liliana, who in the latest interview had a level of poverty of about level two, ie, an average situation, struggling to improve their lives. Among the work she does is selling costume jewelry and through her work helps her family and loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to invest in buying costume jewelry for sale, allowing her to keep growing and struggling to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Lizandra

texts.en:
Lizandra is 40 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lizandra has been in this business for two years.

In the future Lizandra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
19 son las mujeres que forman parte de este grupo, son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por poder dar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
Rosa es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene una pequeña pero surtida despensa, que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar y que hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ha ido creciendo gracias al gran esfuerzo que viene haciendo y sumado al sacrificio que ella y su familia hacen.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, frutas, bebidas, enlatados y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo una buena y fresca variedad de productos a sus clientes.
Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
There are 19 women who form part of this group. They are female heads of households struggling to make a better life for their children.

Rosa is one of the members of this group.  She has a small but well-stocked store, which with great sacrifice she has gotten ahead and now already has very good clientele. It has grown thanks to the great efforts being done and with the sacrifice she and her family make.

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meat, fruits, beverages, canned goods and others items, and thus to continue offering a good variety of fresh products to her customers.

All of the group thank you for the opportunity they receive from further growth.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, fruits, beverages, canned goods and other items.

loans.name: Félix Antonio

texts.es:
Félix de 58 años de edad,  es una persona con buenos principios espirituales con una buena disposición de servicio a los demás,  es padre de 4 hijos es una persona muy amable y buen ejemplo para sus hijos y para su familia; se dedica a la agricultura, desde temprana edad, recuerda con mucha claridad que desde los 12 años acompañaba a su padre al campo donde siembran los cultivos, llevando consigo un machete, una lima y un calabazo con agua como implemento de trabajo, de esta manera adquirió experiencia y conocimiento sobre la agricultura que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingreso, se siente orgulloso de realizar esta actividad ya que le ha servido para llevar el sustento diario a su familia que está formada por su esposa que se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar y dos de sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela nacional y sus otros dos hijos son independientes y se encuentran trabajando para sostener sus propios hogares.

Félix se dedica a la agricultura desde hace unos 45 años,  actividad que aprendió de su padre, quien se sentía  muy complacido de trabajar la tierra. Su día iniciaba a las 5 de la mañana a preparar sus implementos de trabajo utilizando solo herramientas manuales. El lugar de trabajo se encuentra a 4 km de distancia desde su casa.

El dinero del préstamo será invertido para el pago del alquiler de una máquina para preparar el proceso adecuado a las cosechas postreras recién cegadas, de esta forma agilizara el proseo de almacenamiento de sus cosechas.


Los planes que tiene a futuro son los de pagar el crédito y hacer una nueva solicitud de crédito por un monto mayor para diversificar sus cultivos en época de invierno y adquirir un sistema de riego para trabajar en la época de verano y con respecto a sus hijos hará todo lo posible para apoyar en la formación educativa hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Felix, 58, is a person who has good spiritual principles and likes helping others.  He is the father of four children and is a very friendly person; always a good example to his children and family.  He has worked in agriculture since he was young.  He remembers very well accompanying his father to the fields when he was only 12.  He would take a machete, a file and a calabazo filled with water to help him do his work.  In this way, he gained experience and knowledge about agriculture, which has led to it being his main source of income.  He is very proud of his work as it has helped him look after his family.  His wife does the housework and his two children are studying at the moment at school.  His two older children are now living independently and are working themselves to look after their own families.

Felix has been in agriculture for a total 45 years and he feels very happy working with the land.  His day starts at 5 in the morning when he starts to prepare his tools.  He only uses hand tools.  His place of work is 4 km from home.
He will invest this money in hiring a piece of equipment to prepare in the correct way his last harvest which has been recently cut.  This will help make the storage process more efficient.

In the future he would like to pay off the loan and make a new one so that he can invest in a wider range of crops during the winter season.  He would also like to set up a watering system in time for summer.  In his personal life, he would like to support his children through their education so they can be successful professionals in the future.

loans.use: to hire equipment which will help him prepare and store his latest harvest.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es gomero, y con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo esta luchando, en su primer préstamo de kiva lo utilizó en la compra de un equipo de lavadero para poder ampliar su negocio, y que hoy le es de mucha ayuda y ya tiene una mayor clientela.
Antonio pide este nuevo préstamo para la compra de un compresor para su lavadero, para que de esa forma pueda seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Antonio is a tire mechanic who puts a lot of sacrifice and effort into his work.  He used his first loan to buy car washing equipment to expand his business.  It has helped him a lot and he has gained more customers.

Now he is asking for a new loan to buy a pump for his car wash, so that he can continue to offer his customers an excellent service.

loans.use: to buy a pump.

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es: Maria se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en las  agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos,  ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Maria has been engaged in farming for several years and that has given her the skills and knowledge necessary to attend her crops. The principal crop is corn.  When the harvest is ready it is stored in the silos shown in the photograph and then sold to dealers trading in basic grains that are close to their place of residence.

She lives in her own home with her life partner and two children. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural products to assist her in planting her crops such as plant treatment, seed, fertilizer and so be able to have better profits and continue helping with the costs of the home without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy plant treatment, seeds, fertilizers, etc..

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan es de la ciudad de San Pedro, él trabaja como funcionario publico y también tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas. Comenta que  por medio de su trabajo está generando unos ingresos extras para poder sostener a su familia.
El solicita el préstamo para solventar algunos gastos familiares y para la compra de bebidas variadas para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir mejorado sus ingresos y ayudando a su familia.
El agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder seguir mejorando en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
Juan comes from San Pedro.  He is a civil servant but he also has a business selling drinks.  Thanks to this, he can make some extra money to help support his family.

He is asking for a loan to pay for some of the household expenses and to be able to buy a selection of drinks that he can sell.  In this way, he can continue to generate an income and help his family.
