He is grateful for the help he receives which allows him to improve his small business.

loans.use: to pay for household expenses and to buy a selection of drinks for selling.

loans.name: Silbina

texts.es:
Silbina tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que con mucho sacrificio esta saliendo adelante. Ella pidió un préstamo anterior para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su venta.
Hoy pide de un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, embutidos, lácteos, verduras y demás productos para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo un buen producto para la venta a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silbina has a store where she works every day from early in the morning.  She is a very enterprising woman who has set up her business with a lot of sacrifice.  She asked for a previous loan to buy supplies to sell.

Now she is asking for a new loan to invest in meat, cold meats, dairy products, vegetables and other products that she sells.  In this way, she can continue to offer an excellent range of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, cold meat, dairy products, vegetables and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Merie

texts.en:
Merie is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Merie has a rug making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years. Merie would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her rug-making business

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette works hard to support her family. She has a cashew nut business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of cashew nuts to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Suzette would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living through her retail sales of cosmetic and beauty products such as beauty soap, lotion and cologne.

Lolita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like lotion, beauty soap, cologne, etc. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more products to her customers. 

Lolita hopes to make her business successful so that it will generate more revenue, which is necessary for the needs of the family and to pay for the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like lotion, beauty soap, cologne, etc.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh, who is 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an operator at a gas furnace manufacturing company since 2011. His wife is an assistant officer and works at a private firm. Their daughter studies at the elementary school while their three-year-old son stays at home. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to buy building materials such as planks, nails and paint for fence repair. The fences surrounding his private land act as protection against burglary and stop stray dogs coming in. After repairing the fences, his family will live in a more comfortable and safe place.

loans.use: to repair fences.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old and married with two children.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been in the pig fattening business for 25 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of nipa to sell.

Wilma has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Wilma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Reminita

texts.en:
Reminita is 61 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Reminita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cooking oil, coffee, shampoo, laundry soap, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 46 years and sells a variety of items such as the above. 

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cooking oil, coffee, shampoo, laundry soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila works hard to support her family. Prescila is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her business.

Prescila has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Prescila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Presentacion works hard to support her family.

She has a broom making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Presentacion is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her broom making business.

Presentacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional broom making materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy oil, rice, noodles, tea, sugar, flour, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está cursando el segundo año de la carrera Administración. Ella vive con sus padres y hermanos. Trabaja como secretaria y comenta que tiene como objetivo llegar a recibirse de administradora   para así llegar a cumplir con su meta propuesta de llegar a ser administradora de la actual empresa donde está trabajando.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estar más cerca de cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is in her second year of Business Administration.  She lives with her parents and siblings, and works as a secretary.  She says her goal is to get her degree so she can become a manager at the company where she currently works.

Shis is requesting a loan to pay the university fees so she can continue studying and get closer to accomplishing her goal.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 23 años, tiene 3 hermanos, vivían en un establecimiento en el Chaco donde su padre es mayordomo, de allí su deseo de ser Administrador en el campo.
Él está estudiando la carrera de Administración Agraria ya que su sueño siempre ha sido poder ser un profesional útil a las demás personas. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar sus libros y también pagar su tesis, que le permitirá seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juan, 23, has three siblings and they live in an establishment in El Chaco where their father is a butler.  That is why he wants to become a farm administrator.

He is studying for a Agrarian Administration degree since his goal has always been to become a professional in the service of other people.  He is requesting a loan to buy books and pay for his thesis so he can continue his education and get closer to meeting his goal.

loans.use: To buy books and pay for his thesis.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia está estudiando y a la vez trabajando en el área de la carrera de Derecho, quiere llevar una buena vida, mantener una familia por medio de su trabajo.
Ella está luchando por ser una profesional que sirva a las demás personas, es por eso que está luchando por poder sobresalir y ser la mejor.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y cubrir ese gasto que tenía.
texts.en:
Silvia es studying and working in the field of Law.  She wants a nice lifestyle and to be able to support her family through her work.  She is working hard to become a professional at the service of other people.  Therefore, she is struggling to get ahead and become the best she can.  

The loan she is requesting is to pay university fees so she can continue her education and cover her expenses.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan se dedica a la venta de dulces, galletas, chocolates, etc. vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan sells candy, biscuits, chocolates and more on the street in the areas near his house.  He uses the income he generates to pay for the household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and son.  

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies in bulk so that he can continue in business and be able to offer his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy candy, biscuits, chocolate and more in bulk.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 9 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra  de concentrado y vitaminas  para seguir con la crianza de pollos para obtener mejores ingresos con sus ventas y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 31, lives in her own home with her husband and son.  She raises chickens, a job she has been doing for nine years.  She uses the income to help with the household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy concentrated chicken feed and vitamins so she can continue raising chickens and be able to make more profit from her sales.  This will allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy concentrated chicken feed and vitamins.

loans.name: El Pueblo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado El Pueblo, está en su primer ciclo, donde todas tienen su esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Una de ellas es la Sra. Noelia quien se dedica a la venta de lencería.
Noelia es una mujer muy sacrificada que con lucha y esfuerzo está ayudando a su familia para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Su sueño es poder tener algún día una tienda donde poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo, pero generando mayor ingreso para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Noelia solicita de este préstamo para la compra de lencería, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The credit group “El Pueblo” is in its first cycle.  All its members strive to support their families and provide for them things that they often didn’t have.  One of these members is Noelia, who sells lingerie.

Noelia is a hard-working woman who makes a huge effort to help her family and offer them things that she never had.  Her dream is one day to have her own store where she can carry on working as she has been, but have the opportunity to increase her profits to help her family.
Noelia is asking for this loan to buy lingerie, which will help her fulfill her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose estudia en la facultad de Ciencias Agrarias de la Carrera de Lic. En Administración Agropecuaria. Comenta que su objetivo es terminar su carrera y conseguir un buen trabajo, para salir adelante por y para su familia, y de aquí a unos años le gustaría tener una familia, hijos y una hermosa señora a mi lado, juntos en nuestra propia casa. Quiere  cumplir sus metas por la cual está luchando día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar su tesis y también poder cubrir otros gastos de estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir estudiando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jose is a student at the Agrarian Sciences Faculty, studying for a degree in Agricultural Administration. He says his goal is to finish his degree and find a good job, to make headway for his family. In a few years, he would like to have his own family: “some children and a beautiful wife beside me, together in our own home”.

He wants to accomplish his goals, for which he is fighting every day.

He is asking for a loan to invest in paying his thesis expenses and to cover some other education costs. He is grateful for this opportunity to continue to study and to fight as he always has.

loans.use: to pay for his thesis expenses and cover his education costs.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz vive con su mamá que es madre soltera, trabaja de cocinera en un restaurante, al igual que Liz.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de técnico en instrumentación quirúrgica, con lo cual quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas. Su  meta es llegar a terminar su carrera con muy buenas calificaciones para que su mama se sienta orgullosa de ella, Su sueño es tener un buen trabajo para ayudarla.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por su objetivo.
texts.en:
Liz lives with her mom, who is a single parent. They both work as cooks at a restaurant.

Liz is studying for a degree as a Surgical Instrument Technician, with which she wants to be able to help people. Her goal is to get very good grades on her degree, so her mom will be proud of her. Her dream is to get a good job so she can help her.

Liz is asking for a loan to pay her university fees so she can continue to study and to pursue her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Cindy Lucero

texts.es:
Ella es Cindy lucero, tiene 17 años y en este momento de la vida se encuentra en 3 semestre de auxiliar en enfermería.
Siempre ha querido estudiar algo relacionado a la salud y es por esa razón decidió realizar este curso con el fin de dar un paso en  la vida porque este es el comienzo  de la carrera como profesional de la salud. Aquí es donde se da cuenta que es lo que realmente quiere ser, y en el caso de ella lo que quiere hacer toda la  vida es ayudar a las personas enfermas y a todas aquellas que lo necesiten, esforzarse por ser mejor y destacarse en todos los oficios que estén  a  cargo y de esta manera poder ser un ejemplo a seguir para aquellos que ven en ella un ejemplo de vida.
Desarrollarse como persona y como profesional de la salud, es una de las más grandes metas y sabe que poco a poco lo va a lograr, conseguirá todas aquellas metas que se propuso, Poder concluir este proyecto es la meta  a corto plazo y de esta manera poder continuar con todas las que le faltan y llegar a la cima que se propuse desde un inicio.
texts.en:
This is Cindy Lucero. She is 17 years old and is currently on the third semester of her Nursing Assistant degree.

She has always wanted to study something related to healthcare. This is why she decided to take this course and take a step forward in life, since this is the first step towards a career as a healthcare professional. 

This is an opportunity to decide what she wants to do for a living. In her case, she wants to dedicate her life to helping sick people and anyone who might need it, strive to be better and stand out in every job she takes on. She wants to be an example for anyone to follow.

To grow as a person and as a healthcare professional is one of the biggest goals in Cindy Lucero’s life, and she is certain that she will reach it little by little. Being able to finish her degree is her short-term goal, and her way to continue achieving every goal that she has set for herself.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition

loans.name: Rosa Francisca

texts.es: Rosa es una joven de 26 años de edad, madre soltera, con una hija,  originaria del Municipio de Somotillo, se caracteriza por ser una joven honrada, inteligente, social, responsable en su trabajo y su familia, con muchos deseos de superación, se desempeña como maestra de primaria desde hace 6 años, manifiesta que a pesar de los tropiezos que ha pasado a sabido salir adelante por su  hija que es su inspiración y la que la motiva, por lo que se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales, cemento, bloques, madera, zinc etc., para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación y poder brindarle a su hija un techo digno donde vivir,  así mismo mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su pequeña.
texts.en: Rosa is a 26 year old woman and a single mother with a daughter. She is from the town of Somotillo. She is described as being an honest, intelligent, social and responsible woman in her job and her family. She really wants to get ahead, and she has worked as a primary teacher for 6 years. She says that despite the obstacles she has had, she has been able to get ahead for her daughter, who inspires and motivates her. That is why she went to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy materials such as cement, blocks, wood, zinc sheeting, etc. to build a room and be able to offer her daughter a worthy place to live. She also wants to improve her and her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, wood, and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Doña Mabel, una mujer de 43 años de edad, acompañada quien se dedica a la pesca artesanal.Juntos luchan por salir adelante, ella se dedica a su pequeña tienda, donde vende diferentes tipos de golosinas y comida rápida. Doña Mabel ademas de su tienda vende mariscos quien ya lleva 10 años realizando este labor. A ella le gusta mucho la parte del negocio, pues es algo que le da muy buenas ganancias. Hoy en día a Mabel le ha ido muy bien en su negocio, tanto asi que quiere comprar mas producto para mejorar su tienda, sabe que asi tendra mas variedad lo cual indica que habra muchos mas clientes. Con el efectivo del crédito comprara diferentes golosinas, churros, dulces, galletas, sodas entre otras cosas que le ayudaran a prosperar. Ademas, comprara producto para la comida rápida, pan, salchichas, y salsas.

A futuro sueña ver su negocio mas grande con mucho mas producto que ofrecer, no solo eso ademas sueña con tener de nuevo la venta de comida. Que es en tal rubro que ella se destaca mas.
texts.en:
Mabel is a 43 year old woman who is married to an artisanal fisherman.  Together they fight to get ahead. She works in her little store where she sells different types of snacks and fast food. In addition to her store, Mabel also sells seafood and she has been doing this work for 10 years. She really likes the business because that is brings in good earnings. These days the business is going very well for Mabel, so much so that she wants to buy more products for her store. She knows that this way, she will have a wider variety, which means she will have many more customers. With the cash from the loan, she will buy different types of snacks, churros, candies, cookies, soda and more things that will help her prosper. In addition, she will also buy products to prepare the fast food such as bread, sausages and sauces. 

In the future, she dreams of seeing her business grow with a lot more products to offer, and she dreams of selling meals again. That is the area that she stands out the most in.

loans.use: to buy snacks, churros, candies, cookies, soda and other things that will help her prosper. In addition, she will buy products to prepare fast food such as bread, sausage and sauces.

loans.name: Grisell Angie

texts.es: Grisell es una joven que vive con sus padres  por quienes lucha a diario para darles una mejor calidad de vida, Grisell estudia cosmética dermatológica que es una carrera que la apasiona, se encuentra en el tercer ciclo, trabaja en un salón de belleza,  para ella no hay obstáculo alguno que impida que siga estudiando, agradece a EDAPROSPO  por el préstamo otorgado ya que el dinero le ha permitido  comprar cremas, mascarillas maquinas dérmicas, materiales que se requiere durante la carrera en el año de estudio, Grisell se siente feliz de poder contar con personas que la ayudan a seguir estudiando y agradece a KIVA por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Grisell is a young woman who lives with her parents for whom she fights every day to give them a better quality of life. Grisell studies dermatological cosmetics, which is something she passionate about. She is in her third cycle and she works in a beauty salon. For her there are no obstacles standing in the way of her studies. She is grateful to EDAPROSPO  for the loan that has been given because the money has allowed her to buy creams, masks, and dermatological machines. These are materials that she needs for her major this year. Grisell feels happy that she has people that help her stay in school and she thanks Kiva for the help it has given.

loans.use: to buy creams, masks, and dermatological machines.

loans.name: Uche

texts.en:
Uche is 45 years old and a mother of six children. Her and her husband operates a local palm oil mill in Amichi Village. For 4 years now her husband has been ill and can no longer support the mill operation. This mill has been a source of support for her and her family and other members of the village who are mostly farmers. The mill is setup with locally made processing equipment which takes manual workers at her mill hours to produce 100 liters of palm oil. To reduce her frustration and that of other members of the community who use this mill and also to make life easier for manual workers who make their daily living in this mill, Uche is requesting this loan from Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society to enable her purchase additional presser, pounding machine and a nutcracker diesel powered engine.

In the future she will also want to change her mill house roof as most part of the roof is worn out and rain is causing damages to by products stored at the mill.

If this loan is funded, Uche hopes that she will be able to serve farmers in the village which their livelihood depend on farming and palm oil processing better and she will also earn more income to support her  family especially her children school fees and other necessities.

She appreciates all who supports her to come out of this difficult situation.

loans.use: to help Uche purchase a modern palm oil processing digester with spindle press and Nutcracker for her palm oil mill

loans.name: Ebele

texts.en:
Ebele is 42 years old and a mother of five children. She runs a mill located at Elele village, over the years; the mill has suffered much setback because of lack of water in the village. This is common in most villages in Nigeria, local residents depend on local built water well or boreholes within range. This has made life really difficult for rural dwellers especially those that depends much on water to run their business.  The nearest borehole to Ebele family mill is about 2km away from the mill and her customers finds it very difficult conveying water from the borehole to the mill every day. It is expected that after successful construction of this water tank, mill users will increase and also life will be made easier for the manual workers at her mill. Also this will bring in more clients and boost her annual income. The tank is expected to store up to 6,000 gallons of rain water during the raining season which can serve the mill from December until mid March when new rain is expected.

What she is requesting from Kiva lenders is half of the total cost, as she will pay the balance cost from her previous year’s savings

Building this water source tank will not only increase Ebele income but will also make her happy in life considering the fact she and other mill users have suffered much as a result of this.

The mill and their palm trees plantation is their only source of income and from that they support their children school fees and feeding.

She thanks all Kiva lenders who share her pains and lovely contribute to her loan.

loans.use: to help Ebele complete the total cost of building an underground water storage tank for her palm oil mill

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en:
Chinyere is 38 years old and a mother of five children, the eldest is 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4 respectively. She has been into this trade for 5 years, as a mill manual work she process palm oil for clients all year round and during the peak season she face a great difficulty in storing customers products which limits her on the number of contracts she can take in a year. 

This is her only source of livelihood and with enough storage facility, she will be able to maintain her clients and source for new ones. It is expected that if she can have a big storage tank, her annual earning will increase and that will also keep her happy because according to her “I hate to sit ideal while there is work to do it makes me really sad in life”. 

Chinyere is requesting this loan from Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society which she is also a member of the society to enable her purchase 30 plastic drum for storing palm oil.
  
Proceeds from her annual labor work goes to supporting her husband in providing for the family and also paying of her children school fees.

She thanks all Kiva lenders who take their time to read through her profile and also contribute to her loan.

loans.use: A loan of 140,000 Naira will help Chinyere purchase a plastic storage tanks to store processed palm oil for herself and her clients

loans.name: Felix Daniel

texts.es: Félix es un joven soltero que estudia ingeniería de sistemas, en sus ratos libres toca la guitarra y el órgano, estudia ingeniera por que es la tendencia en estos tiempos, Félix está muy contento  con  EDAPROSPO  por el préstamo otorgado ya que su mayor obstáculo eran los medios económicos, Félix espera acabar de pagar la mensualidad de la Universidad y sacar su bachiller para poder ejercer su profesión ya que su mayor sueño es ser titulado y darle bienestar a sus padres. Félix dice “Gracias KIVA  tengan la seguridad que aprovecharé al máximo la oportunidad brindada, sepan que no será en vano.”
texts.en: Félix is a young single man who is studying systems engineering. In his free time, he plays guitar and the organ. He studies computer science because that is the tendency of these times. Félix is very happy with EDAPROSPO  for the loan, since his biggest obstacle was the financial means. Félix hopes to finish making the monthly payments to the university and get his degree to be able to practice his profession. His biggest dream is to have his degree and bring well being to his parents. Félix says: “Thank you, KIVA. Be assured that I will take maximum advantage of the opportunity that has been given. Know that it won't be in vain.”

loans.use: to make monthly payments to the university and pay for his degree.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 18 years now.

Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family.  Mary Grace is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 6 years now.  In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 57 years old and married with six children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.  Florentina is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Florentina has been raising livestock for 30 years and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
Julinda is 51 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Julinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell business offering key chains and other accessories in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Julinda has been in this business for two years. 

In the future Julinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and married with two children.  Wilma works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Wilma has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Wilma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita works hard to support her family.  Estelita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets.

Estelita has been in this business for 3 years now.  In the future, Estelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Satara

texts.en:
Satara belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her son is a blacksmith; he welds the broken parts of bikes.  A few days ago his welding equipment stopped working due to overheating and it needs to be replaced with a new one.  He wants to buy new welding equipment but he does not have enough cash in hand due to a lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Satara has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her son would be able to buy welding equipment for hjis welding services.  Satara thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy welding equipment to weld the broken parts of motor bikes.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is their main source of income.

Mirasol is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for the fishing boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Mirasol has hopes of improving their fishing business and making it a sustainable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for the fishing boat

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Alicia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pegie

texts.en:
Pegie is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school. Pegie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Pegie has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Pegie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Maristela is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari store business. She has been selling various goods and items in her store for more than 12 years now. 

Maristela is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, coffee and sugar, bread and biscuits. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers to her store which will allow her to sell more and augment her profit. In the future, Maristela has hopes of expanding her store and making it sustainable. Furthermore, she wants to save money to pay for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, etc

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling business offering MSE and Natasha products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of MSE and Natasha products to sell. She has been in this business for three years. Melly earns more income from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Melly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of MSE and Natasha products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 40 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Luisa has been farming sugarcane for a year, and also earns additional income from other businesses like general store, motorcycle transport and weaving native baskets. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 24 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Madelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Madelyn runs a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, laundry soap, soft-drinks, bread, etc.  She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF, to purchase additional groceries to sell at her general store.   She has been in this business for a year.

Madelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell at her general store

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is a 32 year old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a mother of three children and a housewife, who looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for builders. In this regard her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron's accessories to improve his shuttering work.  Raheela is applying for loan for her husband's work, so he can generate more income to financially support his family. .
Raheela is thankful to brac Pakistan and kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for shuttering work

loans.name: Vivialyn

texts.en:
Vivialyn is 45 years old and married with two children.  Vivialyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF, to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

Vivialyn has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the running the charcoal business for 9 years and also earns an income from farming flowers.  Vivialyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 28 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marialyn operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year. 

Marialyn requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shakela Group

texts.en:
Shakela is 35 years old, and a mother of 3 children, living in Rawalpindi.  Rozeena is a 26 year old married women and mother of 3 children.  She also lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Sakela is leader of this group loan.  Her husband runs a butcher shop .

She applied for the loan to buy meat in bulk, to serve a large number of customers at her husband's shop.   Her husband wants to overcome the financial issues and increase his business, since he is only earning member of his family.  Sakela has therefore applied for the loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.  She is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan .

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk for their butcher shop.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Analyn requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a charcoal and firewood business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store. 

Marilou requested her tenth loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mariquel

texts.en:
Mariquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines which she has been doing for three years. She earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. 

Mariquel requested a loan from NWTF for 9,500 PHP, which she will use to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: May Rose

texts.en:
May Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She earns additional income from a general store. 

May Rose requested another loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fish to make dried fish for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is aged 35 and lives with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been selling fresh seasonal fruits for many years in his hometown. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling, like a hawker. Due to the freshness of his fruit, he has acquired a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for his fruit has increased and by noon his stock has run out.

Farah is receiving a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business so he will be able to buy fruit in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale for weighing. Now he can sell fruit till evening and can generate more income by selling more fruit. 

Farah wants to save the excess profit amount so she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for resale.

loans.name: Cerenia

texts.en:
Cerenia is 58 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cerenia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cerenia has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 42 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom are currently in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Merlinda has been farming vegetables for 30 years now, and she has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Merlinda requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Erlinda has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mary Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell frozen products business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling beauty products. 

Mary Wilma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her buy and sell frozen products business.

Mary Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 30-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for buildings. In this regard her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work, so that he can generate more income for financial support of his family. 

Fouzia is applying for a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's work. Fouzia is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shuttering work

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a small business selling beauty products to the ladies of her hometown, door to door. She roams from one door to another carrying a basket of beauty products on her head to offer in her community. She purchases local cosmetic products such as nail polish, lipstick, talcum powder, face powder, etc. from the market at a low price and sells it at a higher price. She wants to grow her sales on a daily basis but she does not have enough cosmetics products to offer.

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan so she can buy more quantity of cosmetics for resale. She wishes for the bright future of her children and dreams to provide better education for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell door to door.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, wood, paint, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat.

Jennifer has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, wood, paint, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Pildausa Ruth

texts.en:
Pildausa Ruth is 60 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a accessories shop in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more accessories to sell.

Pildausa Ruth has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.  Cristina is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her pig-fattening business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 41 years old, married and has eight children.

She earns a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. Norma has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

Norma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aneceta

texts.en:
Aneceta is 45 years old and married. She has six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Aneceta has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Aneceta is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 24 years old, married, and has one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Rosalie is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell peanuts business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her business.

Emelinda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Florentina works hard to support her family.

She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Florentina is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional computer for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Florentina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old, married, and has six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teresita has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store. 

Teresita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal, farming rice and selling pre-paid mobile loads. 

Nieves is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her businesses.

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. Patricia has been in this business for 50 years. Patricia earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Gina has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop business in the Philippines.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for ten years. Ma. Theresa earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her welding shop business like iron, welding rods, galvanized iron, etc.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like iron, welding rods, galvanized iron, etc

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan is 50; she is a mother of five children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products, selling milk, curd, butter, etc. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He daily sells milk to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from his milk sales. He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He is in need of one cow to increase his income, so Hafeezan asked for a loan. In this way she can support her husband's business.

Hafeezan thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new cow for milk sales business

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 32-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a butcher shop, but he earns insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy meat from the market and sell it from his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which lowered his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop.
 
This is the reason Shabana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a bull calf to produce meat. She wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams of providing all facilities of life to her children. 

Shabana is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a bull calf to produce meat for reselling.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat is a 49-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a business of household items on rent, in which he provides beds on rent to the general public. He has been doing this work for many years. To carry out his work, he has to stay at the shop to deal with customers. 

He wants to buy more beds to cope with demand, but due to the high cost, he is unable to purchase them. 

Jannat hopes that with the Kiva loan, her husband will be able to carry out his plans of purchasing more beds for his rent business. So she requested a loan so that her husband could buy more beds to enhance his business.

Jannat thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more beds for the rent business.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jona is 43 years old and has seven children who are currently in school.

Jona has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods like blouses, shoes, etc. to sell.

Jona has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods like blouses, shoes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, canned goods, etc. for her food vending business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell. She has been in this business for eight years. Lida earns more income from ice and juice vending.

Lida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines. Jonalyn has been in this business for four years. Jonalyn earns more income from a general store.

Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farming business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 46 years old and married with five children.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like noodles, soft drinks, shampoo, eggs, biscuits, etc., to sell.

Anecita has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Anecita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like noodles, soft drinks, shampoo, eggs, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Haneefan

texts.en:
Haneefan is a 42-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building. In this regard her husband needs  raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work, so that he can generate more income for financial support of his family.

 Haneefan is applying for a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shuttering work

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Narcisa has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Narcisa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a most efficient cooking energy using Liquefied Petroleum gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the most efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas in order increase sleeping time for her daughter

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place le 08 Décembre  2012 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il est composé de femmes très désireuses de développer des activités génératrices de revenu afin de mieux servir leur famille respective. Elles partagent des liens forts de solidarité dans la mesure où elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 22 ans, mariée et mère d’une fille et d’un garçon,  malgré son jeune âge elle demeure très engagée dans les activités du groupement. Elle est vendeuse de légume et divers produits alimentaires savoir le sucre, le thé vert, …. Produits qu’elle achète dans le marché hebdomadaire de la zone. 

Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter du sucre pour un sac, 02 grosse de thé vert et un carton de lait en poudre.

Les bénéfices, elle les utilisera pour accroître son cheptel de caprins d’une part et d’autre part à mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created on 8th December 2012.  It is made up of women who all want to develop their income-generating businesses, in order to better provide for their respective families.  They have all lived in the same village for several years and share very strong bonds of mutual support.  All the women are small traders.

Mariama (sitting on the far right of the photo, with her hand raised) is the main borrower.  She is 22 years old, married and has a daughter and a son.  Despite her relative youth, she is a very active member of the group.  Mariama sells vegetables and various other food products such as sugar and green tea.  She buys her supplies at the local weekly market.  She will use the loan to buy a sack of sugar, green tea and a box of powdered milk.

Mariama will use her profits to increase the size of her goat herd, and help her husband provide for the expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, green tea and a box of powdered milk.

loans.name: Sorpene

texts.en:
Sorpene is 49 years old and married with six children.

Sorpene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Sorpene has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and buying and selling dry goods.

Sorpene successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Sorpene aspires to save money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maila works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maila is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish business.

Maila has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 64 years old and married with three children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, shampoo, soft drinks, bath soap, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Evangeline aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, shampoo, soft drinks, bath soap, cooking oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Mylene has been in this business for four years. Mylene earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felomina is 50 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Felomina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Felomina requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Felomina has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Felomina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 67 years old and married with five children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, eggs, etc.

Norma has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Norma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, eggs, etc

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 54 years old and married with five children.

Gleceria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Gleceria has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Gleceria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years. She earns additional income from selling meat.

Jena requested her sixteenth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, chips, bread, etc. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Hadyatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est  à ce jour composé de femme dont la détermination à développer une activité génératrice de revenu et améliorer de ce fait leur condition de vie anime chacun d’entre elles. Les femmes font le petit commerce comme activité principale, elles pratiquent aussi l’agriculture sous pluie. Elles partagent des liens forts de solidarité car vivant dans le même village depuis plusieurs années. 

Madame Hadyatou (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et un garçon. Elle achète et revente les produits du terroir au grand marché hebdomadaire de la sous région plus précisément l’arachide, le pain de singe et autres produits agricole.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter en quantité et au moins 15 sacs d’arachide et une dizaine de sacs pour le pain de singe destinés à la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’apporter un soutien à son mari sur la prise en charge sanitaire des enfants et leur scolarisation.
texts.en:
Today, this Banc Villageois is made up of women who are each and everyone driven by their determination to develop their money-earning businesses and, hence, improve their standard of living.

Their main business is retail, and they also grow crops during the rainy season. They share strong bonds of solidarity since they've been living in the same village for several years.

Mrs. Hadyatou, sitting on the right and raising her hand in the photograph, is the group's featured borrower. She's 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children, two girls and one boy.

She buys and resells local products, such as peanuts, baobab tree fruits, and other farming products at the weekly grand market of the subregion.

Her new loan will enable her to buy in quantity at least 15 sacks of peanuts and 10 sacks of baobab tree fruits to resell.

Her profits will enable her to support her husband in taking care of the children's healthcare and school expenses.

loans.use: 15 sacks of peanuts and 10 sacks of baobab tree fruits

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en octobre 2012, le banc villageois vient d’entamer son troisième  cycle dans le programme. Les femmes commencent à maîtriser les caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village, leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Coumba (assise à droite et en médaillons vers le bas toujours à droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 50 ans, est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 filles et 03 garçons. Son activité consiste l’achat et la revente de sucre, de thé vert et divers produits de consommation courante.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de sucre, quels que paquets de thé vert et divers autres produits pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’aider son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was established in October 2012 and is starting its third loan cycle in the Banc Villageois program. The women begin to master the loan and savings specifics. They all live in the same village, and their main business is retail.

Mrs. Coumba, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph, is the featured borrower. She's 50 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, four girls and three boys. Her business consists in buying and reselling sugar, green tea, and various other staples.

With this loan, she intends to buy one sack of sugar, some boxes of green tea, and other products to retail. Her profits will be used to help her husband handle the daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: one sack of sugar, some boxes of green tea, and other products

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois dont fait parti Maguette, a été crée le 02 juillet 2011. Il regroupe des membres très solidaires et dynamiques qui s'activent et pour la plupart dans le commerce.
Maguette est âgée de, 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 2 garçons. Elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de poissons fumés, une activité qu'elle mène depuis 2008. Avec le prêt elle va acheter 300kg de poisson séché pour un montant de 390000f cela peut lui revenir à 510000f.
Les bénéfices lui permettent d'épargner et de prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created on 2nd July 2011.  The members are all very supportive and dynamic, and most of them work in small sales ventures.

Maguette is a member of the 'banc villageois'.  She is 42 years old, married and mother to seven children (of whom two are boys).  She has worked selling smoked fish since 2008.  She will use her loan to buy 300kg of dried fish, this will cost 390,000 francs CFA.  She hopes she will make 510,000 francs CFA.  She intends to save some of her profits and use the rest to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Guillerma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Guillerma has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Lilia requested her eleventh loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband provides transportation services by using a Motor Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads to cover small distances. He has been driving it over rough roads, which caused a high depreciation. His rickshaw has become fully depreciated; he has sold his old motor rickshaw and wants to buy new one. But the selling amount does not fully cover the cost for purchasing a new rickshaw. 

This is the reason Amina has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy a new motor rickshaw that drives smoothly. 

Amina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a motor rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 02 juillet 2011. Il est constitué de membres habitant le même quartier et qui entretiennent de bonnes relations. Elles comme activité le commerce.
Amy debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 1 garçon.
Avec le prêt elle compte faire de la vente de tissu. Elle va acheter un rouleau de tissus de 600 yards à 250000f. Elle va revendre le yard à 600f. Le reste de l'argent va lui servir de fond de roulement.
Elle va réinvestir les bénéfices dans son activité et renforcer son épargne au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of three women belongs to the village bank which was created on the 2nd of July 2011. It is made up of members who live in the same neighbourhood and get on well together. Their work is commercial.
Amy, who is standing up on the right of the photo, is 37 years old. She is married with seven children of which one boy.
With her loan she plans to sell fabrics. She will buy a roll of 600 yards of fabric for 250000f. She will sell the fabric at 600f per yard. She will use the remainder of the money as working capital.
She intends to reinvest the profits in her business and increase her savings in the village bank.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 54 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, soap, shampoo, coffee, and cream.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, soap, shampoo, coffee, and cream.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 50 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Edna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 40 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been in pig fattening for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. Vicenta is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Vicenta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Vicenta has been in this business for 5 years now.

Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Amy Colle's Group

texts.fr:
Ces 2 femmes font parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 02 juillet 2011. Ce banc regroupe des femmes qui ont une même appartenance religieuse et qui sont très solidaires. Elles font comme activité le commerce.
Nogoye debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 1 fille. Elle fait comme activité la vente de tissus. Elle va acheter 6 coupons de tissus à 17500f l'un,  pour revendre un coupon à 20000f. En activité parallèle, elle va élever des poussins.
