Les bénéfices lui permettent d'épargner et de soutenir son fils dans ses frais scolaires.
texts.en:
These two women are members of the 'banc villageois', which was created on 2nd July 2011.  The women share the same religion and are very supportive of one another.  They are both small traders.

Nogoye (standing on the right of the photo, with her hand raised) is 48 years old.  She is married and has four children, one daughter and three sons.  She sells fabric, and will use her loan to buy six pieces of fabric for 17,500 francs CFA each.  She will sell each piece for 20,000 francs CFA.  Alongside this business, Nogoye will also raise poultry.

Nogoye will save some of her profits and use the rest to support her son with his school fees.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2009.Il est composé de membres qui habitent la même commune,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Fatou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et mére de 03 enfants dont un garçon.

Avec son crédit,elle compte investir dans le transport avec l'acquisition d'une nouvelle moto dénommée Jakarta.

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité,augmenter son niveau d'épargne et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group was created in 2009. It is made up of members who live in the same commune, and work in small trading activities.

Fatou, who is on the right of the photo with her arms raised, is the leader of the group. She is married with three children of which one boy.

With her loan, she plans to invest in the transport business by purchasing a new sort of motorbike called a Jakarta.

Her aim is to reinforce her business, increase her savings, and pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to provide transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 21 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella  tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 5 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de su residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que hay su casa, la clienta solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
The client is 21 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has had a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers for the past 5 years. She has a good clientele as she sells her food at a good price. Her business is located close to her place of residence. She can help pay the household expenses with what she makes.

The client is requesting a loan that would allow her to buy everything necessary to make her sandwiches and hamburgers like bread, onions, tomatoes, mayonnaise, sausages and other ingredients so she can generate more money and continue to help with the expenses that occur in her house.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onion, mayonnaise, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has raises livestock in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her livestock.

Lolita has been in this business for 4 years. Lolita earns additional income from fish vending.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 50 years old and married with four children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, and cooking oil to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Nilda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is 56 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Warlita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Warlita requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional gear for her fishing business.

Warlita has been in this business for 8 years. Warlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 51 years old and married with three children. Andrea works very hard to provide for them.

Andrea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Andrea has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, shampoo, etc. 

Andrea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Âgée de 42ans, madame Améyo revend des produits d'alimentation générale au marché. Avec son cinquiéme crédit à WAGES, elle souhaite s'approvisionner en marchandises pour pouvoir satisfaire les clients. Elle espère réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans l'activité, ouvrir une boutique et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Aged 42, Mrs. Ameyo sells general food products at the market. With her fifth loan from Wages, she would like to stock up on merchandise in order to be able to satisfy her clients' needs. With her supplementary profits she hopes to re-invest in her business, open a shop, and manage her affairs more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra de 39 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos , es casada y ella estudio hasta segundo grado y su esposo se dedica  a la agricultura, tienen 4 hijos y tres viven con ella de los que dos estudian y el otro trabaja con su esposo, la niña le ayuda con los oficios domésticos en la casa, ella ayuda a su esposo con los cultivos que siembra y con el cultivo que tiene a su poder, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas específicamente, abonos y pesticidas, ya que cultivan 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz con regadillo a unas dos cuadras de su casa, espera que en  futuro sus hijos sean profesionales y con el negocio espera tener mayores producciones para solventar las necesidades básicas y con las ganancias invertir en compra de ganando.
texts.en:
Sandra is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her 4 children. Three of her children live with her, two of them study and the other works with her husband. Her husband is a farmer. Sandra does domestic work. She studied up to Grade 2. Her daughter helps her with the housework and Sandra helps her husband with the crops they grow.

Sandra needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs, specifically fertilizer and pesticides. They grow 14,000 square meters of corn with irrigation a few blocks from their home. Sandra hopes that her children become professionals in the future. For her business she hopes to have higher production to pay for their basic necessities and to invest in the purchase of cattle with the profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion works hard to support her family. Asuncion is married and has a roasted whole pig vending business in the Philippines.

Asuncion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs as well as ingredients and other materials for her business.

Asuncion has been in this business for 5 years now.

Asuncion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs as well as ingredients and other materials for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Cecilia has a fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fertilized duck eggs to sell to her customers.

Cecilia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilized duck eggs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes works hard to support her family. Gertrudes is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gertrudes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gertrudes has been in this business for 6 years now.

Gertrudes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 32 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su familia, ella posee una pequeño negocio ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, Dora esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de lana, hilos, ganchos y colas para el cabello, agujas, etc. para poder surtir con mejores productos su negocio y asi obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dora is 32 she old and lives with her family in her own house. She has a small business located at her house. She has a lot of clients for the variety of products that she sells and with the money she makes she pays some of the household expenses.

Dora is requesting a loan to buy wool, thread, hair clips, needles, etc to stock her store with better products so she can generate more profit and provide her family with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, hair clips, needles, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 53 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, soft drinks, etc. 

Juliet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Al- Shorouk Group

texts.en:
Al- Shorouk is a group with three members. All of them are females. They live in Mokala, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Saeda is a 42-year-old widowed woman, living with her children in a very old house. She is the leader of the group. Saeda is an uneducated woman. After the death of her husband, she became the sole breadwinner of her small children, and bears all responsibility for them. 

Now, Saeda wants to renovate her old house, but she doesn't have money for that work. She is a thankful woman to anyone who can help her in completing that work. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement, bricks, and other bulding materials.

Saeda looks forward to building the second floor in the house and renting it in order to get a fixed income for her children. Her dreams are of opening a savings account in AMB bank and sending her children to a private school.

loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks, and other bulding materials.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a roasted whole pig business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional pigs, spices, and other supplies for her business.

Leonora has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, spices, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
Ma. Elma is 37 years old and married, with two children. With one child currently in school, Ma. Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, laundry soap, toothpaste, coffee, noodles, and soft drinks.

Ma. Elma has been in this business for ten years and she sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, laundry soap, toothpaste, coffee, noodles, and soft drinks. 

Ma. Elma would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, laundry soap, toothpaste, coffee, noodles, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an internet café. Luz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, spices, vegetables, meat, etc. for her business.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, spices, vegetables, meat, etc. for her business

loans.name: Graciela De Jesus

texts.es: Graciela de 49  años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a vender refrescos y gaseosas cerca de su lugar de residencia ya tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus productos a un buen precio con las ventas que realiza logra obtener buenas ganancias que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le puedan presentar, Graciela solicita un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería ya que últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda y asi poder surtir de mas productos su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Graciela is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son. She makes a living selling juices and soft drinks close to her home. She has many customers because she sells her products at a good price. With her sales, she is able to obtain good earnings that allow her to cover the household expenses  and other needs that may come up. Graciela is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise because lately she has had a lot of demand and will be able to stock her business better to earn more and thus offer her family a high standard of living.

loans.use: to buy juices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maribeth is 40 years old and has five children who are in school.

Maribeth has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more ingredients for her business, like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, and noodles.

Maribeth has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her businesss, like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, and noodles.

loans.name: Ndeye Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été le 02 juillet 2011. Ce dernier regroupe des membres qui ont une bonne relation et une bonne cohésion sociale. Elles exercent comme activité le commerce.
Ndéye, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mère de 5 enfants dont un garçon. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de tissus et de boubous. Avec le prêt elle va acheter divers façons de tissus, cela dépend de la demande de la clientèle.
Avec les bénéfices, elle gère les besoins de ses enfants.Elle améliore les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle va acheter les fournitures scolaires et habillement de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group, composed of three women, belongs to the banc villageois [launched] on July 2, 2011. The group members have good rapport and social ties. They work as vendors.Ndéye, the one standing on the right in the photo raising her hand, is 38 years old. She has five children, including one son. She sells fabric and traditional outfits. With this loan, she will buy various type of fabric depending on the customer demand. Thanks to her revenues, she provides for her children’s needs and improves her family’s life conditions. She will buy school supplies and clothing for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tradtional outfits.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is married and has six children. He is from Talibon, Bohol. He operates a hog raising business, which he has been doing for more than 20 years. 

Timoteo requested a loan, which he will use to buy additional piglets to raise. With this loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of his hog raising business thus augmenting his yield and income. In the future, Timoteo hopes to expand his business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family especially for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee un negocio de venta de calzado lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Lucia esta solicitando un crédito a  INTEGRAL para la compra de zapatos por mayor y asi seguir con su negocio  ya que esa es su única fuente d trabajo y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lucia lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She owns a shoe sales business, located in the market near her residence. With the profits she makes and with the help of her husband they manage to cover household expenses. Lucia is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase wholesale shoes and continue with her business, since this is her only source of work, and to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Rene Abel

texts.es: René vive en casa de un familiar el se dedica a la compra y venta de leche desde hace varios, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, Rene está solicitando un crédito para la compra de leche por mayor para seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
René lives in a relative’s house.  He has been buying and selling milk for several years.  He sells in an itinerant manner in the different neighborhoods that are close to where he lives.  He manages to get ahead with what he gets from his sales.

René is requesting a loan to buy milk wholesale in order to continue with his sales.  This is his only source of income, and he will be able to give his family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy milk wholesale.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 59 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Leonarda has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Leonarda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Vive en casa propia con su hija. Doña Maria solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su hija.
texts.en:
Maria has worked selling tortillas at her home for several years. She works from Monday to Sunday and has a large clientele as she is a very hardworking and nice person. With her earnings she is able to pay her household expenses. She lives in her own home with her daughter.

Doña Maria is asking for a loan to buy quintals (large sacks) of corn in order to continue making tortillas and in this way obtain better profits to have better economic stability together with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. María vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, piñas, tomates, chiles, papas, cebollas,  etc. por mayor  ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad,  para darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Maria, 47, is a hard worker who dedicates herself to her business, all with the sole desire to succeed and, thus, provide a better life for her family. Maria lives with her two children at home. She has a business selling fruit and vegetables which is located in the market that is close to her home. She has done this work for several years. Maria requests a loan to buy papayas, bananas, pineapples, tomatoes, pepper, potatoes, onions, and more at a bulk price so she can sell more, which is her priority in order to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell through her general store business, like canned goods, noodles, eggs, and soap.

Janeth has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal and pre-paid mobile load.

Janeth successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, eggs, and soap.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is single and sells bananas in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. She requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more bananas to sell. In the future, Marife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Leonorica

texts.en:
Leonorica is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Leonorica requested a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Анары - среднее образование. По характеру Анар очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная, честная. Вместе с мужем Анар занимается животноводством, стартовав 28 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,300 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Анар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 гол. бычка, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,200 сомов (KGS) от реализации молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анар обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Доходы от кредита Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку нового автомобиля.
texts.en: Anar is 46 years old and married. She and her husband  have four children. Anar has received secondary education. By nature she is very conscientious, outgoing, optimistic, and honest. Together with her husband, Anar raises livestock, having launched this business 28 years ago by buying cattle for 8,3000 KGS. Thanks to Anar’s hard work, her farm now includes four dairy cows, two bulls, and one horse. Her monthly income from selling milk is 9,200. In order to develop her farm further, Anar has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to increase her livestock by buying cows. Anar plans to use the revenues from her loan for an additional expansion of livestock. She also plans to save money in order to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Responsabilidad Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios trabajadores y exitosos en sus negocios, está coordinado por la señora Aracelly de 32 años de edad, casada y con un hijo de 7 años, se dedica a la venta de bisutería como pulseras, anillos, cadenas, chapas, brazalete, etc, vende comida rápida en su domicilio como sandwish, hamburguesas, hot-dog, entre otros y también compra-vende zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños en las comunidades cercanas a su domicilio, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y su mamá, es una socia que desempeña multiples funciones para mejorar cada día su vivir y así brindarle las mejores condiciones que ella pueda a su hijo, ya ha trabajado con esta institución en ciclos anteriores y asegura haber visto mejoras en su vida personal y en su negocio, esto la motiva a seguir prestando para seguir progresando, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de bisutería y zapato principalmente. Otros socios son el señor César de 44 años el cual vende cosméticos de niños, damas y caballeros, los compra en el mercado capitalino y los comercializa en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three hard-working members who are successful in their businesses.  Aracelly, age 32, is the coordinator.  She is married and has a seven year old son.  She sells costume jewelry like bracelets, rings, chains, and pins, etc.  She sells fast food like sandwiches, hamburgers, and hot dog, among other things, at her house.  She also buys and sells shoes for women, men, and children in the communities that are close to her house.  Her husband and her mother help her.

She is a member who engages in multiple functions in order to improve her life every day.  This way she provides the best conditions that she can for her son.  She has worked with this institution in previous cycles.  She affirms that she has seen improvements in her personal life and in her business.

That is what motivates her to continue borrowing in order to continue progressing.  She will use the loan to buy mainly costume jewelry and shoes.

César, age 44, is another member.  He sells cosmetics for children, women, and men.  He buys them at the market in the capital, and he sells them in his community.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad  vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su hermano, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, azúcar, aceite, dulces, golosinas, refrescos, pan, leche, etc. para poder surtir con mejores productos su negocio y asi obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her two children and her brother. She has a small store in her place of residence and has a lot of customers because of the variety of products she sells. Her sales cover some household expenses. Maria is requesting a loan to buy basic staple goods such as sugar, cooking oil, sweets, candy, soft drinks, bread, milk, and more to fill her business with better products in order to obtain a better income to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store with basic staples such as sugar, cooking oil, and sweets.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married and operates a fruit vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years. She works hard to support her family.  

Nancy requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fruits such as apples, oranges, mangoes, etc. to sell in her fruit stall. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits such as apples, oranges, mangoes, etc. to sell in her fruit stall

loans.name: Busadat

texts.ru: Бусадат 43 года, замужем воспитывает троих несовершеннолетних детей. У Бусадат - среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Семья Бусадат  в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1990 года занимается разведением скота. Имеет 2 головы дойных коров, 10 голов овцы и 4 лошади. Бусадат начала этот бизнес с 5,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бусадат , она смогла развить и расширить свой бизнес, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц, что служит основным доходом семьи.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бусадат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку двух дойных коров. Доходы от кредита заемщица планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет приобрести автомобиль для семьи, построить сарай для скота и купить две юрты для джайлоо.
texts.en: Busadat is 43 and married with three children. She has a high school education and is well respected by her neighbours, who refer to her as a kind and hardworking woman. Busadat and her family have been raising cattle as their primary source of income since 1990. They have two milking cows, 10 sheep and four horses. Busadat started this business with 5,000 KGS, and thanks to her hard work, she has been able to develop and broaden her business, and now brings in about 15,000 KGS per month, which is her family's main source of income. With the goal of further developing her business, Busadat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase two milking cows. She plans to use profits from the loan for further improvement of her business, and in the future she wants to purchase a car for her family, to build a shed for her livestock and to buy two yurts for living in at the mountain pastures during the summer.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Doña Lorena nació en una comunidad cerca de el Sauce a los de 18 años se caso y ha procreado  5 hijos de este matrimonio  con mucho esfuerzo  ella y su esposo han adquirido unas tierras y han construido una pequeña casa para vivir, su fuente de  ingreso para mantener a su familia es  el cultivo de granos básicos y  tienen unas cabezas de ganado y crianza de cerdos , en la comunidad donde ellos viven no cuenta con energía eléctrica, y ella desea tener luz en su casa para poder ayudar a sus hijos con sus tareas por la noche ya que en el día los dos trabajan, por eso solicita el préstamo para poder comprar un panel y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Lorena was born in a community close to El Sauce.  She got married when she was 18, and they have five children.  With great effort, she and her husband have acquired some land and have built a small house for them to live in.

Her source of income to support her family is growing basic grains, having a few heads of cattle, and raising pigs.

The community where she lives does not have electricity.  She wishes to have light in her house in order to be able to help her children with their homework at night.  This is because they both work during the daytime.  Therefore, she is requesting the loan to be able to buy a solar panel and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Paz De Maria

texts.es: Paz de 48 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Paz tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Paz, age 48, lives with her life partner and their children in their own house.  She grows corn and beans.  She has been working in agriculture for several years, and this has gifted her with a lot of experience that allows her to get the best harvests.

She sells her harvests in the areas surrounding her community.  She has a lot of customers that prefer her for the quality, good prices, and most of all for her good service.

She needs to invest.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy seeds, insecticides, and herbicides, etc.  Paz has good payment references from those who know her, and she is very responsible.  She affirms that she will be able to repay the loan during the established time frame.  She is confident that this will bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc.

loans.name: Rissa

texts.en:
Rissa is 33 years old, with five children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Rissa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell, like diapers, soft drinks, eggs, and soap.

Rissa has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Rissa aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like diapers, soft drinks, eggs, and soap.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 29 years old and has a live-in partner, with one child. With one child currently in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for her family.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Rowena has been in this business for six years and she sells a variety of items, such as coffee, cream, sugar, juice, canned goods, and cooking oil. 

Rowena would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa de 48 años de edad,  estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos y solamente uno vive en casa. El esposo se dedica a la agricultura, en su casa también vive su nuera.

 Rosa se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a los oficios domésticos, en temporadas tienen un negocio de ventas de tortillas y lo realizan en su casa y la nuera le ayuda con las labores.

Necesita el crédito para comprar bloques, cemento y varillas para levantar pared alrededor de la casa; ya que es de lámina; porque en el invierno se le filtra el agua y se moja dentro de la casa, sueña con tener una vivienda construida de bloques para tener mayor seguridad en todo aspecto.
texts.en:
Rosa, 48 years old, studied through fourth grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has four children and only one lives in the house. Her husband works in agriculture. Her daughter-in-law also lives in the house.

Rosa has been a homemaker most of her life. At times they have a business selling tortillas in their home and her daughter-in-law helps her with the work. 

She needs the loan to purchase cinder blocks, cement and rods to build a wall around the house. Since it is made of metal sheeting, the water leaks in in the winter and it gets wet inside the house. She dreams of having a house built of cinder blocks because it would be safer in all respects.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement and rods to build a wall around the house.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike has a milk and bread supply business in Nairobi town. He is 35 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with 1 child. 

He will be using this loan to buy a motorcycle, and he will use it for supplying milk and bread. This will enable him to serve many customers, as well as make more income. He will be using the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his 4th loan with VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid back his previous loans successfully. In the future Mike hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for supplying milk and bread.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, de 51 años de edad, está casada con Tito y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Doris se dedica a la confección de ropa para todo tipo de ocasión, como polos, camisas, faldas, calzones y otros. Realiza su trabajo en su casa propia en un ambiente que acondicionó especialmente para la exhibición de sus trabajos terminados. Se inició en esta labor gracias a que estudió en un centro de educación ocupacional, invirtió su propio capital para pagar su matrícula, ella sabía que la inversión le daría muchas  satisfacciones, cuando tenía los conocimientos técnicos precisos compró máquinas de costura y materiales  y empezó a dar sus primeros pasos en este negocio. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace más de 6 años, tiempo que le sirvió para ser reconocida entre sus clientes por la calidad de costura que aplica a las prendas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzará con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria.
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, blondas,entre otros.
texts.en: Doris, 51, is married to Tito and has 2 children. They live together in their own home. Doris dedicates herself to making clothing for all occasions such as polos, shirts, skirts, pants, and others. She does her work at home in an environment that she created especially for exhibiting her completed work. She began this work because she studied at a vocational education center and invested her own capital to pay her tuition. She knew that the investment would give her a lot of satisfaction. After gaining her technical expertise, she bought sewing machines and materials and began to take the first steps in her business. She has done this work for over six years and she has become known among her customers for her quality sewn garments. This time she is requesting a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles. She is very happy to have the financial support she is receiving because it will advance her business and she can become a great entrepreneur. She will buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, lace, and more with her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, lace, and more.

loans.name: Gloria Concepción

texts.es:
Gloria de 56 años de edad, es casada, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es madre de un hijo mayor de edad, ella estudio hasta sexto grado.  Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella se ha dedicado toda su vida a los quehaceres de la casa; también le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura ya que siembran 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijol que se lo venden al gobierno y actualmente van a  sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde va a sembrar, a futuro espera que le vaya mucho mejor en el cultivo y sacar buena producción para obtener ganancias para pagar el crédito, también para obtener ganado a futuro, como ingreso extra para su hogar.
texts.en:
Gloria, 56, is married. She does household work. She is the mother of an older child. She has a sixth grade education. Her husband works in agriculture and she has dedicated her life to doing housework. She also helps her husband in agriculture in their 14,000 sq. meters of land planted with beans that they sell to the government. Now they will plant 14,000 sq. meters of corn.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo is to pay rent on the land that they will plant. She expects to do much better in the future, getting a good production for profit to repay the loan. She also wants to get cattle in the future to bring in extra income to her home.

loans.use: to rent the land on which she will plant corn.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more food packs to sell.

Catalina has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food packs to sell

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang (in the photo) is 40 and lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one son and two daughters. One of her children is a garment factory worker and the other two attend school.  

Neang is hired by her villagers to farm and gets paid with fees. Her husband is a motor taxi driver.  Neang is staying with her parents, but she wants to live separately. Hence she decided to apply for a loan to buy wooden materials as well as pay for building fees to build a house.

loans.use: build a house

loans.name: Mauro Antonio

texts.es: Mauro de 49 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que lo visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante junto con su familia, Mauro quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo, puertas y pintar su casa pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, pintura, madera y pago de mano de obra para poder mejorar su vivienda y asi puedan vivir comodos y seguros junto con su familia.
texts.en: Mauro, 49, lives with his wife and children at home. He has a tortilla business in his home and he has done this work for many years. He has earned many customers with his excellent service. He is very friendly with people who visit. He always has a smile on his face for them. His earnings help him cope with family expenses. Mauro wants to improve his home by fixing the roof, changing the doors, and painting his house. What he earns was not enough to pay for it so he applied for a loan to purchase paints, wood, and to pay laborers to improve their housing so he can live more comfortably and safely with his family.

loans.use: to purchase paint, wood, and pay laborers to improve his home.

loans.name: Griselda Marisel

texts.es: Griselda  de 35 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su madre, ella posee un negocio de venta de granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, café, etc. en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de la casa, ella esta solicitando un crédito para comprar mas mercadería por mayor y asi seguir vendiendo ya que esa es su única fuente d e ingresos y asi poder tener junto con su madre una mejor vida, sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Griselda is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her mother. She has a business selling basic staple goods such as cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and more in the market that is close to her home. Her earnings help pay household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale and continue selling well since it is her only source of income. She wants to have a better life with her mother without some of their limitations.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale basic goods such as cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and more.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teofila is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Teofila has a business selling personal products in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of personal products to sell.

Teofila has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy personal products to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 40 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school.  Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Josefina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Josefina has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.  She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Josefina is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy stocks for her general store

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 43 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Annaliza has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013.  Annaliza requested a PHP 3000 bridge loan through NWTF to  buy additional stocks of beauty salon products for her business to restart her business activities.

Annaliza has been in this business for 5 years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Annaliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy beauty salon products

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Teresita works hard to support her family.  She has a business direct-selling Avon and personal collection products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

Teresita is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy more Avon and personal collection products to sell to her customers.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy personal products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a dressmaking business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business.  She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy sewing materials and supplies

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 41 year old and married with six children, four of whom are in school.  Sarah works very hard to provide for them.

Sarah's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Sarah has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Sarah has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Sara is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: rebuild her house

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion has a live-in partner woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Concepcion has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Concepcion has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rezilda

texts.en:
Rezilda is 36 years old with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rezilda's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Rezilda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rezilda has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rezilda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and eventually would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is 46 years old and married with 3 children, who are all in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Cresenciana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, soft-drinks, beers, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Cresenciana has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Cresenciana would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, soft-drinks, beers, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sakr Group

texts.en:
Sakr is a group consists from four women living in Mokala, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Maryam is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 4 years old and the youngest one is 2 years old. Maryam studied the elementary school, but she couldn't complete her study because of the hard condition of her family.  She is the leader of this loan group. 

Maryam works as a housewife. Her children are small and there is no one who can help her in the housework. Maryam wants to purchase appliances for her house, but she doesn't have enough money.  For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator for the house.

Maryam hopes to be able to provide for her family's needs and to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator for her house

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 55 years old and resides in Rizal. She is a responsible mother of two kids. Her husband helps her in running their business of furniture making and polishing for the past twenty years. Both manage the household.

Dominga's husband needs to buy different types of supplies for the business, e.g. polish, oil, wood, etc. to fulfill their business needs. Due to insufficient financial capital he is unable to buy these items for the business.  Therefore, Dominga has requested a loan amounting to PHP 50,000. With the help of this loan amount, she will provide financial assistance to her husband so that he can easily purchase these items.

loans.use: buy furniture making materials

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 33-year-old woman from Kakamega county.  She is married to Bernard, who is a businessman in the same town.  They have two children, aged six and five respectively.

She operates a timber yard, a business she has run for the last eight years, earning an average income of 15,000 KES per month. She is taking her second loan of 22,500 KES with Vision fund Kenya to use in buying more timber. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan and build some savings. Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase additional timber in bulk to boost her stock levels

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. Angelina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Angelina requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell.  She has been in this business for 30 years now.

Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
Leonesa is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells charcoal in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. She earns additional income from selling ginger and young coconuts.

Leonese requested her twentieth loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 71 years old and widowed, with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Lucrecia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase rice seeds and other farm supplies.

Lucrecia has been farming rice for 11 years and she also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is a married woman with 8 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has 4 children who are still in school.

Dorotea has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc. for her business.

Dorotea has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 49 years old and has five children.  She is married and two children of her children are in school.

Roselyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Roselyn is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a new house for her family. 

Roselyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her iron fabrication business. 

With your help, Roselyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family, and save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: rebuild her house

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Epifania requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Epifania would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 43 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Antonia has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  She requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetables stand.

Antonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно замужем и является матерью троих сыновей. Ей 39 лет. Она в своем районе Спитамен занимается собственным малым бизнесом. Барно  имеет продуктовый магазин и занимается там продажей продуктов питания. Она продвигает этот бизнес уже 6 лет и зарабатывает наравне мужа. Ее сыновья подрастают и старший из них закончит школу в этом году. Она заботится об образовании детей и хочет, чтобы они получили высшее образование. Но сегодня поступление в университет стоят немалые деньги и поэтому Барно хочет расширить свой бизнес. Она на сумму кредита планирует закупить еще один холодильник и витрину в свой магазин. Кредит поможет реализовать ее планы и она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Barno is 39, married, and the mother of three sons. She runs a small business in the Spitamen district. She has owned her grocery store for six years and earns as much money as her husband. Her sons are nearly grown up and the oldest will finish high school this year. She cares a lot about her children's education and wants them to go to university. Barno wants to expand her business because tuition is expensive. She intends to use the loan to buy another refrigerator and display case for her store. The loan will help her achieve her goals and she hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and display case to expand her business

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Thida (in the photo) is 27 years old and lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one son who is in school.  

Thida is a garment factory worker. Her husband has a wedding canopy business. Thida decided to apply for a loan to help her brother buy a new motorbike because his old motorbike does not work well and uses a lot of gasoline.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for her brother

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael is 28 years old and a single mother of one child, aged 6 years, whom she supports.  Abigael runs a food stall business in Kapsabet town in Nandi County. She has been in this business for the last three years.  From this business she get a monthly income of KSH 20,000. 

Abigael has borrowed a loan of KSH 70,000 to purchase wheat flour, baking powder, yeast, sugar, salt maize flour, tea leaves, rice, and other food items she will need to use in her food stall.

Abigael will use the anticipated profit to expand her business, make some savings, and repay the loan.  Her dream is to give the best to her family, to meet their financial needs and give the best education to her child, expand her business to a more modern and classy restaurant, as well as open branches in other nearby towns.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a refrigerator for his butcher shop

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Goretti, a 55-year-old, widowed mother of three from Embu, owns a business selling cereals and other grains. Her children are 18, 15 and 10 years old respectively. She has been doing this business for the past three years successfully. She currently lacks the capital needed to purchase items in bulk to restock her store. 

With a loan from VISIONFUND KENYA, Goretti will be able to purchase items in bulk when she finds goods at low prices. She will then be able to have a fully stocked store which will attract more customers, generate sales, and create more profit due to a lower cost of goods sold. Additional income created will allow her to reinvest in her business, meet the needs of her family, and educate her children through college. 

In the future, Goretti would like to eradicate poverty and uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items in bulk

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 24 years old.  She is from Kihoto in Naivasha and is married. They have one child who has not started school yet. Her husband is a fish vendor  and helps to provide for the family.

Salome has a school uniform business that she has been running for the past two years.  She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy a motorbike that will be used for transportation purposes.  She hopes to buy a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 57 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Bebiana works very hard to provide for her family.

Bebiana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Bebiana has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, bath soap, diapers, snack foods, softdrinks, etc. 

Bebiana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an efficient cooking energy package of liquefied petroleum gas in order to cope with her workload.

loans.name: Gultamze

texts.en: Gultamze is a 43-year-old, married woman, from the village Ude, Adigeni district. She has nine family members, and the significant source of income they have is from agricultural activity. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Gultamze was unable to study for a professional career.  Gultamze and her husband work hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing potatoes. They always have high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. As the existing income is not enough for nine family members, she decided to expand her agricultural business. After several unsuccessful attempts, Gultamze applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With the loan 3,000 GEL she will purchase goats, produce and sell cheese, and also sell lambs for a good price. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to provide her family with better living conditions.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Gultamze is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to increase productivity.

loans.use: To purchase goats

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy  is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. He is a construction worker and lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. The son has full-time employment for a hotel and his wife is a garment worker.

Vy’s son commutes to work by taking motor taxis, spending a lot of money. Vy requested a loan, which he will use to purchase a motorcycle for his son to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his son to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy maize for his posho mill

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 57-year-old widowed mother of one child.  She has been running her convenience store for three years to improve her living and make sure that she can keep on covering her family's needs.

Aziza is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special offer products that will develop her business and increase her income.

Aziza is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing repayment history. This is her nineteenth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  Her previous loans where invested in covering her family's needs and developing her business gradually.

Aziza is willing to increase and diversify her products in a well-managed way to expand her business.

loans.use: buy products for her store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.  

Rosalina has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Rosalina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business to help her family to recover what she lost during the typhoon.

loans.use: rebuild her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an affordable and efficient cooking gas package.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elvie works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Elvie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell through her dried fish-vending business.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 28-year-old married mother of two children.  Six months ago, she started a home-based business to  sell clothes.  She wanted to help her husband to meet living expenses and cover their beloved children's increasing needs.

Rasha requests a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her inventory with special released spring/summer collections to meet her customer's needs and increase her income.

She works hard to develop her business and she is starting to be well known in her region.  Her customers are gradually increasing because of her special reputation, quality of merchandise, and affordable prices. 

She wants to keep her business at home because she prefers to be there at anytime for her beloved family members.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special released spring/summer collection to meet customer needs and increase her income.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a 38-year-old married man with one child. 

To sustain his family, he sells pork. He hopes to increase his sales and earnings so that he can pay for  the education of his children. He asks 50,000 PHP to buy more meat to sell. He will continue to sell good quality meats and achieve his customers' loyalty. 

In the future, Florencio hopes to improve his income for his family's overall welfare.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Maris

texts.en:
Gloria Maris is 49 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria Maris operates a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. 

Gloria Maris requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Gloria Maris would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 55 years old, married, and has ten children, six of whom attend school. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport and rice retailing. 

Ofelia requested another loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hermita

texts.en:
Hermita is 56 years old and single. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Hermita requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items such as shampoo, bread, snack foods, cereals, candies, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as shampoo, bread, snack foods, cereals, candies, etc.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran lives in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four sons and one daughter. One of her children is married, one is soldier, another one is a construction worker and the other two attend school. 

Saran is a weaver, a traditional profession for her. Her husband is a construction contractor. Saran’s husband wants to buy more construction materials, but he does not have the money. Saran decided to apply for a loan to buy construction materials. She will use a rest of the loan to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to but construction materials for her husband's construction business and purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is 33 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar,and  noodles.

Jacquelyn has borrowed and repaid 3 previous loans from NWTF . She has run a general store for 2 years and earns additional income raising pigs .

Jacquelyn aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns additional income from selling clothes. 

Madelyn requested a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Cooproriz Isabane Gp5 Group

texts.en:
Clementine is a member of Cooproriz Isabane Gp5 Group. She is married, with two children. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business, so that, in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath  lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live in separate homes; two assist their mother in the business; and another one is in school.

Sambath is a weaver. In addition, she buys cotton and silk products from the weavers in her village and sells them in other places in the community. Her husband is a primary-school teacher.

Sambath wants to buy new motorcycle because the old one is breaking down and does not work well.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Gloria Concepcion

texts.es: Gloria de 53 años de edad vive sola en su propia casa ya que sus hijos viven en estados unidos y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar.  Gloria se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para ella lo más importante son los clientes ya que sabe que manteniéndolos satisfechos con el servicio que presta seguirán prefiriéndola y su negocio seguiría siempre activo. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria is 53 years old and lives in her own home since her children now live in the U.S. and help her with household expenses.  Gloria is known for being an honest woman.  She is hard-working and above all entrepreneurial.  A few years ago she was able to establish a small store inner home and thanks to God and her hard work and dedication the business is known in the zone and she can count on many customers.  For her, customers are the most important since she knows that keeping them satisfied with the service that she offers will make them continue to prefer her and her business will remain busy.  For this reason she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner INTEGRAL in order to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her store.  She plans to purchase items such as: eggs, candies, sugar, rice, milk, beans, pastries, and other articles that will be attractive to her customers.  In this way she hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy eggs, candies, sugar, rice, milk, beans, pastries, and other items.

loans.name: Algin

texts.en:
Algin is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She is a 30-year-old married woman with two young children who are 5 and 3 years old. Algin has been in the business for almost five years.
 
She asks for a loan to purchase canned goods, candies, soda and toiletries. She will be able to improve the variety of her stock and augment her sales and income. In the future, Algin hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, candies, soda and toiletries.

loans.name: Daisy Len

texts.en:
Daisy Len is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She requests 25,000 through PHP NWTF to buy a fishing net for her fishing business.

Daisy Len has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income operating a general store.

Daisy Len has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Little Seed Preparatory School (D) Group

texts.en:
Loving and hardworking mother Chongcha says that life is tough for her, but she would do anything to have a stable home for the children. Chongcha and her son are pictured with their hands raised. She is 32 years old and a mother to two children. She works in a private school as a teacher, and apart from teaching, she gives private tuition at home after school. Her husband is a daily wage earner, and his income is undependable. As it is very difficult to run the family with just 2,500 INR per month salary, Chongcha gives extra private tuition at home in order to have more cash flow in the family. 

Her eldest son is in junior level, and her youngest son is still in preparatory. Chongcha says her children are very brilliant and she has high hopes, for which reason she is investing all her time and effort to bring up her children to become what they wish to be in life. 

As she could not afford to pay all the expenses for her child’s education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to give her financial assistance to pay for her son’s admission fees, textbooks and other necessary expenses for schooling. Like other mothers, she also wishes to provide her children a decent education and career. 

She thanked Kiva for being so generous and helpful.

loans.use: to pay for her son's admission fees, textbooks, stationery and other necessary annual expenses for the academic year 2014.

loans.name: Sinon

texts.en:
Sinon is a silk weaver and her husband is a motor taxi driver. She lives in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
