Noel es un campesino de 38 años de edad, dedicado desde muy joven a las labores del campo, oficio aprendido de su padre y que hoy en día se ha convertido en su alternativa de vida. Actualmente posee cultivos de café, plátano y árboles frutales, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado y en la cooperativa de caficultores del municipio donde reside, así genera los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (semillas de café, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) y pagar la mano de obra de los jornaleros que empleará para sembrar 9000 palos más de café, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción, con lo cual incrementarán las ventas y por ende los ingresos que percibe al vender los productos.
Noel manifiesta que a pesar de los diversos desafíos que se le presentan por el clima y los altos costos de los insumos, él quiere seguir luchando para sacar adelante su agroempresa y poder brindar oportunidades de empleo a los campesinos de su comunidad, además de mejorar las condiciones de vida y bienestar tanto propio como el de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Noel is a 38 year old man from the countryside who has worked as a farmer since he was very young. He learned this work from his farmer and today he has made it his life. He currently has crops of coffee, bananas, and fruit trees whose fruits are collected and sold in the marketplace and in the municipal coffee-growers cooperative. In this way, he generates the income he needs to support the household expenses. 
The requested loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies (coffee seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticides) and to pay the day-laborers that he will employ to plant 9,000 additional coffee bushes. This will enable him to increase production and so to increase his sales and, consequently, the income that he receives for selling his produce. 
Noel tells us that, despite the many challenges presented by the climate and the high cost of supplies, he wants to keep striving to have a successful agribusiness and to be able to offer employment opportunities to the people in his community, in addition to improving living conditions and wellbeing for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (coffee seeds, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides)

loans.name: María Dolly

texts.es:
María es una mujer campesina de 35 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde que se casó aprendió todas las labores del campo, ya que su esposo tiene un terreno donde cultiva algunos productos y adicionalmente trabaja como jornalera recolectando cosechas en fincas vecinas; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fungicidas, abonos y fertilizantes, con lo que podrá reabonar la tierra para sembrar nuevamente y así tener una cosecha más productiva que le genere mejores ingresos a la hora de vender el producto.
María sueña con tener más cultivos de diversos productos, entre ellos las hortalizas, para aprovechar el terreno que tiene disponible en la finca de su esposo y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y brindar mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a 35 year old woman from the countryside. She is married and the mother of 4 children who she has raised with effort and dedication. 
Since she got married, she has learned all about farm work as her husband has land where she grows produce and she also works as a day laborer harvesting for neighboring farmers. In this way, she earns enough to help her husband cover the household expenses. 
The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fungicides, manure, fertilizer, with which she will enrich the soil before resowing. This way, she will have a more productive harvest that will generate more income when the produce is sold.
María dreams of growing a greater variety of produce, including vegetables, in order to take advantage of the land available at her husband's farm and to increase the profitability of the business and guarantee a better quality of life for her family and offer her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, fungicides, manure, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 24-year-old single man, who operates a studio in Embu. He has been running the studio business for the past 4 years successfully with a monthly income of KES 14,000 which he uses to support himself and his mother. 

This marks his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to purchase a new digital camera and a printer. He will use the proceeds from his improved business to set up another studio in a different location and repay his loan. 

He dreams of becoming an established businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a new digital camera and a printer.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a seaweed farming business. Her husband works as a fisherman. These are the source of their income.

Marichu is asking for a loan to buy materials for seaweed farming such as seaweed seedlings, straw, nylon and rope. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her seaweed production thus increasing her harvest and yield. 

In the future, Marichu hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for seaweed farming such as seaweed seedlings, straw, nylon and rope.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty, age 23, sells grocery items from her home in a village about 22 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She lives with her widowed mother and has two children. Her husband is a garment factory worker.

Ty is asking for a loan to repair the house where she lives and to install a restroom. She will also use a part of the loan to expand her grocery store by buying more grocery items. 

Photo: Ty is in front of her grocery store.

loans.use: To repair her house, add a restroom, and buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an over sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a hotel business in Nairobi. She is 53 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she is blessed with seven children. 

She will be using this loan to buy more food for her hotel business, including rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, and cereals. This will enable her to serve more customers, and in turn, make more income. She will use the generated profits to expand her business.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully. In future, Mary hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy more food for her hotel business, including rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, and cereals

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo nació en una comunidad en el Municipio de El Tuma la Dalia, lugar donde estudio primaria, para luego dedicarse a trabajar en las tierras de su papa, a los 20 años de edad conoce a la que actualmente es su esposa con quien a procreado 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 están en la escuela, con mucho esfuerzo  adquirió una propiedad en  y empezó a trabajar en Agricultura y a sembrar granos básicos como el café, el cual es uno de los principales rubros con los que el cuenta, en esta comunidad no hay energía eléctrica y para poder alumbrarse por la noche usan candiles, los que  han causado enfermedades en sus hijos por el humo  y también los han expuesto al peligro causando accidentes, razón por la cual con el desea adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar su panel solar y dar a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Pablo was born in a community in the municipality of El Tuma-La Dalia.  This is where he went to elementary school and later started working the land with his father.  He met his wife when he was 20 years old, and together they have 5 children, 4 of whom are in school.  With a lot of effort, he acquired a property and started to work as a farmer, cultivating staple crops like coffee.  This is one of the main activities that he does.  In his community there is no electricity; to get light at night they use lamps, which have caused illnesses in their children because of the smoke.  In addition, they have exposed them to danger, causing accidents.  This is why he wants to take a loan to buy solar panels so that he can give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a small solar energy system

loans.name: Hed Al- Waytat Group

texts.en:
Hed Al – Waytat is a group of four women, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB.

Hend is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She is the leader of the group. Hend is an uneducated woman, but she is very ambitious. She works hard to improve the income of her family. She started her business many years ago by selling door-to-door. In the beginning of her business, Hend applied for a first loan from AMB and purchased many kinds of women's clothes. Unfortunately, all of her profits went to her family expenses. Now, she doesn't have any capital to continue her business, so she applied for a second loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to return to her business. She wants to purchase more clothes for women and children.

Hend looks forward to providing her family with a lot of money and sending her children to a private school. Her dreams are expanding her business and selling a piece of land in order to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah City. He lives with his wife and five children, three sons and two daughters, in a small and simple house. He is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Rami is also a university student who is studying to earn a master's degree in psychology.  

Rami took a Murabaha loan from FATEN so he can buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Rami will be able to write his reports and read articles online. 

Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: La señora María es una mujer trabajadora de 30 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 4 años, dedicada a la venta de cosméticos AVON y ropa de segunda n su domicilio, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes de damas, perfumes de niños, perfumes de caballeros, vanidades, pintura labial, pintura de uñas, delineador, entre otros, además comprar ropa de segunda para jóvenes, damas y caballeros
texts.en:
Sra. María is a hardworking 30 year old woman, who is married and the mother of a 4 year old son. She sells AVON cosmetics and second hand clothing at her house. 

She needs a loan to purchase cosmetics, such as women’ perfume and children’s and men’s cologne, compacts, lipstick, nail polish, eye liners and other items. In addition, she wants to buy second hand clothing for youths, women and men.

loans.use: to purchase products, such as compacts, blush, lipsticks, nail polish, perfume for women and cologne for men.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 30 years old and he is from Nakuru. He is married to Erinah and they are blessed with two children, ages 8 and 6.

Fredrick has been running a blacksmith business for the last 10 years. To enable him to buy more raw materials such as scrap metal so he can make frying pans, cooking pots and chicken feeding troughs, Fredrick has applied for his third loan of KES 72,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 50, 000 and he has plans of using the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, Fredrick hopes to be the main distributor of frying pans, cooking pots and chicken feeding troughs in his area.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal for making frying pans, cooking pots and chicken feeding troughs.

loans.name: Lino Nemecio

texts.es: El señor Lino acompañado y padre de tres hijos de las edades de 5, 3 años y un bebé de 5 meses, se dedica a la compra-venta de verdura, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de verduras como tomate, yuca, quequisque y cebolla, se ha dedicado a comercializar estos productos por más de 10 años en el mercado local y mercado capitalino más populoso.
texts.en: Lino lives with a partner and is the father of 3 children aged 5, 4, and 5 months.  He works buying and selling vegetables.  He needs a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, cassava, quequisque (a tuber), and onions.  Lino has been selling these products for more than 10 years in the local market and in the more crowded market in the capital.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry feed and chicks

loans.name: Mará Antonia

texts.es: La señora María es una mujer exitosa, acompañada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 12, 6 años y el bebé de 3 meses, comercializa ropa nueva de niños, jóvenes y adultos, el crédito lo requiere para comprar camisas de niñas, camisolas, calcetines, camisetas para caballeros, camisas de mujer, brasieres, blúmer, bóxer de damas, bóxer de caballeros, y más variedad, cuenta con la el apoyo de su esposo en la comercialización de su mercadería.
texts.en: Mara is a successful woman.  She lives with a partner and is the mother of 3 children aged 12, 6 and 3 months.  She has a business selling new clothing for children, youths, and adults.  She needs a loan to buy a variety of children's shirts; sport shirts, socks, boxers and T-shirts for men; and shirt, bras, and panties for women.  She has the support of her husband in selling her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Banco Mujer Perseverancia Group

texts.es:
Doña Loida es la secretaria de Banco Mujer Perseverancia , un grupo con mucha trayectoria y una excelente conducta de pago, junto a ella están en el grupo 5 socias más que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y de pequeña industria. 
Esta señora es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, tiene 53 años, es casada, madre de 2 hijos, únicamente su hijo menor vive con ella y cursa estudios universitarios. Doña Loida desde muy joven se inicio como costurera, con los años se fue perfeccionando, confecciona ropa a la medida y también cortinas, ropa de cama, set de baño y otras prendas. Este es el sexto crédito que solicita, y los anteriores le permitieron siempre surtirse de materia prima, como toda clase de telas, para siempre poder cubrir los pedidos, cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Esta nueva inversión será para la compra de más telas ya que tiene muchos pedido de diferentes prendas. La ayuda de los créditos para ella y su familia ha sido de gran impacto, ya que pudo darle los estudios a su hija mayor, y continua haciéndolo con su hijo menor, ya que verlo graduado como un profesional es su mayor anhelo. Ella continua trabajando con la misma motivación y con muchos planes a mediano plazo, entre esos está apoyar a su esposo con los gastos ya que quieren hacerles una mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Loida is the secretary of Banco Mujer Perseverancia (Perseverance Women's Bank), a group that is going places and has an excellent repayment record. Along with her, there are 5 other members of the group who are going to invest in commercial activities and light industry. 
This lady is a woman who strives hard and works hard. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Only her youngest son lives with her and he is at university. When she was very young, Loida began working as a dressmaker. Over the years, she has perfected her trade and she makes tailored clothing and curtains, bed clothes, bath sets, and other articles. This is the 6th loan that she has requested, and the earlier ones all enabled her to stock-up on raw materials such as fabrics so that she could always meet her orders and satisfy her customers' demands. She will use this new loan to buy more fabric as she has many orders for different articles. These loans have had a great impact on her and her family as she was able to give her daughter an education and now is doing the same for her son, and seeing him graduate into a profession is her greatest desire. She continues working with the same motivation and with many medium-range plans, including helping her husband with the expenses as they want to make some improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, and other things.

loans.name: El Alfarero Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras, es coordinado por la señora Alejandra de 30 años de edad, acompañada y a cargo de un hijo de 6 años, es comerciante de frutas, pues ella compra las frutas por temporadas para luego comercializarlas en el mercado local y en algunas temporadas en el mercado más populoso de la capital, cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá para la venta de las frutas y con el crédito invertirá en compra de frutas como papaya, melón, sandía, piña y jocote. Otra de las socias es la señora Ingrid de 32 años de edad dedicada a la fabricación de ropa nacional, la señora Blanca de 25 años elabora productos a base de maíz como tamales, pinol, pinolillo, entre otros, la señora Ismara de 25 años produce ropa nacional y por último la señora Drusila de 27 años quién comercializa ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group comprises five hardworking women. Alejandra coordinates the group. She is thirty years old, lives with her partner and has a six-year-old child. She is a fruit vendor. She buys seasonal fruit to sell at the local market. At certain times of the year she also takes it to the busier market in the capital. Her mother helps her with her business. She will invest this loan in buying fruit like papaya, melon, watermelon, pineapple, and jocote. 

Ingrid is another of the group's members. She is 32 years old and works making traditional clothing, as well as Ismara, who is 25. Blanca, also 25, makes corn products like tamales, pinol, pinolillo, and other items. Lastly Drusila, who is 27, sells new clothing.

loans.use: to buy fruit like papaya, melon, watermelon, pineapple, and jocote.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es: Grupo de mujeres exitosas y laboriosas, coordinado por la señora Rosa de 41 años de edad, soltera y con dos hijos, solamente una a cargos de la edad de 15 años, se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas por temporadas, con este crédito invertirá en tamarindo, mango y jocote principalmente, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija en vender los productos ofrecidos, se desarrolló en este negocio con los préstamos que le ha hecho esta institución, debido a que llevan nueve ciclos de estar trabajando con esta institución. Otra socia es la señora Silvana de 44 años la cual elabora tejidos como es manteles ya sea para mesa grande, mantel para mesa pequeña, mantel cuadrado, mantel redondo, y mucha más variedad, también lo integra la señora Sadia de 32 años de edad, propietaria de una librería en su casa y es la encargada de vender en el bar de una escuela cercana a su comunidad.
texts.en: A group of successful and hardworking women, coordinated by 41 year-old Rosa, who is single and has 2 children, only one of whom (the 15 year-old) is in her charge. She works buying and selling seasonal fruit. She will use this loan to buy tamarind, mango, and jocote (a type of fruit). She can count on her daughter to help her sell her produce. She has developed her business with loans made to her by this institution and she has had 9 loan cycles with this institution. Another member is 44 year old Silvana, who weaves items such as tablecloths for large tables and small tables, square cloths, and round cloths, and much more variety. They also include 32 year old Sadia who runs a bookshop from her home and is responsible for sales in a cafeteria in a school close to her community.

loans.use: to buy tamarind, mango and y jocote (a type of fruit)

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan  tiene 46 años, tiene 3 hijos todos ellos mayores que con mucho esfuerzo está sacándolos adelante. El señor tiene venta de bebidas y además tiene una pileta que explota en el verano como balneario.
Su señora tiene una despensa ambos trabajan  viven en la ciudad de Ita desde hace 15 años, y de esa forma ambos se ayudan para poder seguir trabajando.
 El préstamo lo pide para la compra de  bebidas varias  ya que tiene mucha concurrencia de personas, y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old. He has three children, all of them adults, and he has expended great efforts to help them get ahead.  Juan has a beverage shop, and he also has a swimming pool which he exploits in the summer as a public bathing area. 

His wife has a neighborhood store, and both have lived and worked in the city for 15 years. In this way they each help each other so that they can keep working. 

He is requesting the loan to buy an assortment of beverages, since he has a lot of competition from other people, and he would like to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 41-year-old married father of three in Thika. He is married to Kamene, who is a farmer. Robert has been operating a welding workshop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,700, which he uses to provide for his family. 

Robert is applying for his second loan term with VISIONFUND KENYA after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to purchase more metals and a new welding machine. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children and buy food for the family. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a comfortable family and an established welding business.

loans.use: to purchase more metals and a new welding machine

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin is a 35-year-old married man and a father of four young children from Talibon, Bohol. Darwin earns a living through his sari-sari, or retail store business. Darwin started in his store business 13 years ago. It is a good business and it helps him provide for his family, especially for the schooling of his children. 

Darwin is asking for a loan worth 18000Php to buy more food to sell, like canned goods, candies, beverages, bread, biscuits, coffee, and sugar. This loan will enable him to expand the variety of his goods and sell more to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell, like canned goods, candies, beverages, bread, biscuits, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Gerardo es un hombre trabajador y exitoso de 69 años de edad, casado y padre de cinco hijos, de los cuales ninguno depende de él, se dedica a la venta de leña en su domicilio y a la cosecha de maíz, cuenta con la ayuda de su nieto para la siembra, el señor invertirá en siembra de riego de maíz pujagua y requiere fertilizantes, pagar el agua, de este modo obtener mayores ganancias, debido a que existe una gran demanda de este producto por parte de la población, el socio lo comercializa en el mercado del municipio.
texts.en: Gerardo is a hard-working and successful man, 69 years old. He is married and the father of five children, none of whom are dependent on him. He works selling firewood from his home, and also growing corn. He has the help of his grandson for the work of planting. He will invest in planting irrigated Indian (pujagua) corn, and he needs to buy fertilizer and pay for water. In this way he will obtain higher earnings, since there is a great demand for this product among the local population. The borrower sells his products in the municipality's market.

loans.use: to plant Indian corn, buy fertilizer, pay for water and labor, and cover other costs.

loans.name: Jovenes Artesanos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jóvenes Artesanos está en su ciclo 7º del programa de comité de Jóvenes, donde todos estos jóvenes están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para empezar a trabajar y generar un poco de ingresos para ayudar a su familia. 
Uno de los integrantes es Juan, él es consciente que como un miembro más de su casa que con el trabajo que él hace está ayudando a sus padres se dedica a la venta de forma ambulante que hace con la ayuda de su padre.
El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prenda y calzados para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, para poder ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group called "Jóvenes Artesanos" is in its seventh loan cycle of the communal bank program for youth, where all these young people are putting their best effort into starting to work and generate a bit of income to help their families. 

One of the members is Juan, and he is aware that as one more member of his household, that with the work he is doing he is helping his parents. He works as a street vendor with help from his father. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can spend it to buy clothing and footwear, and be able to continue selling as he has been doing and help his family.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra.  Maria es soltera, pero tiene su pareja, no  tiene hijos, ella se dedica al servicio de alquiler de vivienda, esta actividad lo realiza con la ayuda de su pareja, gracias al trabajo que realiza va aumentando más locales para alquilar.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante y crecer. Solicita este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, para poder remodelar las viviendas que alquila. Sueña con  seguir ampliando su  negocio, implementar otros rubros y dar fuente de trabajo  a las personas.
texts.en:
Sra. María is unmarried, but she has a partner. She does not have children. She provides a service renting housing. She runs this business with the help of her partner. Thanks to her work, she has been expanding the number of places for rent.

She is a very hardworking person who struggles to get ahead and to grow. She is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials to remodel the housing that she rents. She dreams of continuing to expand her business and is looking for other business opportunities so that she can be a source of jobs for people.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to remodel rental housing.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 40 year old single mother of six. She is a  business lady in Embu who earns her living by operating a private medical clinic. She has been operating the clinic for the past 20 years successfully and earns a monthly income of KES 20000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is requesting her fourth loan from VISIONFUND KENYA in order to buy building materials to expand the structure of her clinic and use the remaining amount to purchase more drugs. 

With the additional income, she will reinvest in the business. She hopes to the expand clinic into a hospital and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy building materials to expand the structure of her clinic

loans.name: Adyamata Shg Group

texts.en:
Adyamata Self-Help Group is a group consisting of thirteen members of whom all are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they could provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs. Jhunarani, who was selected as their president. Jhunarani is a 46-year-old lady living with her husband. The lady standing with her raised hand is Jhunarani. Her husband works as a farmer. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. Jhunarani likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which reason she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables. 

Jhunarani, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 130,000 INR.

loans.use: to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a thirty-four year old M-Pesa agent (a mobile-phone-based money-transfer service) and retail shop proprietor at Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single lady who supports only herself and has been in this business for the last six years doing great.

This marks her third time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the requested money to purchase bottled water and increase her M-Pesa float. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. She hopes to have several businesses of the kind in town center.

loans.use: to purchase bottled water and increase her M-Pesa float.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Creciendo Unidas Group

texts.es: Doña Alba es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Creciendo Unidas, tiene 54 años de edad, es casada. Es porcicultora desde hace más de 20 años, cuenta con una porqueriza con tres cerdos y dos cerdas preñadas. Por su trayectoria y años de experiencia ella ha logrado ubicar en su casa un Biodigestor , el que le genera gas para cocinar. Así evita contaminar el ambiente con los desechos de los cerdos y los utiliza correctamente. Ella desea este crédito para invertir en la compra de más cerdos ya que es una buena época para criar estos animales. Desea continuar con su actividad ya que esto le permite aportar económicamente al hogar y continuar viviendo dignamente. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la facilidad de los trámites y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en: Alba is the president of the communal bank "Mujer Creciendo Unidas" ["Women Growing Together"]. She is 54 years old and married. She has raised pigs for more than 20 years. She has a pigpen with three pigs and two pregnant sows. Thanks to her history and her years of experience, she has been able to install a biodigester in her home, which generates gas for cooking. Thus, she avoids polluting the environment with the waste from her pigs, and she uses it appropriately. She would like this loan in order to invest in buying more pigs, since it is a good time to raise these animals. She would like to continue with her work, since it allows her to contribute economically to her household and continue living with dignity. She says she chose Fundación Mujer because of its simple paperwork and low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Chandaneswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Chandaneswar Self-Help Group was formed with nine members in 2012 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Malati as the leader of their group. The lady standing with her raised hand is Malati. 

Malati is a 41-year-old woman living with her husband and her two children. For ten years, Malati’s husband has been working as a farmer to support his small family. It is not sufficient to manage the family's financial needs, however. So, Malati is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the milk business. She has five years experience in this business. 

She has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can add to her family’s income. Malati says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her children to a good school; through that, she can provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for her business.

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es:
Ercilia es una señora de 57 años de edad, que estudio hasta sexto grado pues en la época que ella  estudio era bien difícil seguir estudiando, ella es casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos, es madre de 10 hijos de los cuales la gran mayoría ya se casaron y están aparte. En su vivienda vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos más y también tiene nietos que ella  está a cargo y que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela solo 1 persona depende de ella. 

Ercilia se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y a cuidar de su familia, comenta que desde la infancia se dedica a esta actividad, gracias a su madre que le enseño a realizar esta actividad                                                                                                                             cuando estaba pequeña, otra actividad que tiene es la agricultura acompañado de su esposo y sus demás hijos realizan trabajos de cultivos de granos básicos (maíz, frijol) pues es una actividad que le genera cosechas granos para el sustento alimentario de su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para invertirlo en la agricultura, específicamente comprara abonos orgánicos, semilla para el cultivo y para la preparación de la tierra; pues ellos año con año siempre siembran su parcelita de cultivos, esto le permitirá cosechar sus propias cosechas de esta manera no quedar desabastecido durante el año de alimentos. Sin la ayuda del préstamo no lograrían hacer sus cultivos que año con año hacen. 

Ercilia es una señora que desea mucho para el futuro en primer lugar, mucha salud,  bienestar,  paz todo con la ayuda de Dios, también desea mejorar su vivienda que ya la tiene un poco deteriorada y para sus hijos lo mejor que sepan educar a sus hijos que sean personas de bien en la sociedad, y en general tener una mejor calidad de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Ercilia is a 57-year-old woman with a sixth-grade education; during the era when she was studying, it was quite difficult to stay in school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture, growing staple grains. She is the mother of ten children, the majority of whom are already married and on their own. In her house, she lives with her husband and two more children. She also has grandchildren who are in her care and who are currently in school. She only has one dependent.

Ercilia is a housewife, taking care of her family. She says that since childhood, she has performed these duties because when she was little, her mother taught her this work. She also works in agriculture, accompanied by her husband and her other children. They work growing staple crops (corn, beans), as it is an activity that generates grain harvests for her family's dietary sustenance. 

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to invest in agriculture, specifically to buy organic fertilizer and seed for planting, and for the preparation of the soil. Year after year, they always plant crops on their little plot. This allows them to harvest their own crops so that they don't run out of food during the year. Without the help of the loan, they will not manage to do the planting that they do every year.

Ercilia is a woman who wants a great deal for the future; in the first place, good health, wellbeing, and peace, all with God's help. She also would like to improve the house, which now a little deteriorated, and for her children to known how to educate their children so they will be good people in society. In general, she would like to have a better quality of life for her whole family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seed for planting, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Ambruteswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Rukmani is a 44-year-old lady living with her husband and her five children. In the picture, the lady standing with her raised hand is Rukmani. 

She runs a snack stall in her village; she has a few years of experience in this activity. She sells snack items like samosas (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), 'idli' (a popular recipe of south Indian origin made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and rice), 'wada' (lentil doughnuts), etc. in her shop. 

She wants to expand her business by selling more of the items she sells now and to make a display case for her shop for the products she cooks. She says that doing so will attract more customers to her shop. 

Rukmani, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 110,000 INR. She wants to utilize her portion of the loan to purchase raw materials like potatoes, spices, edible oil, lentils, rice, etc. and for making a display case for her shop. 

She has a dream of having her children study in a good school and saving some money for their future. 

Ambruteswar Self-Help Group has eleven members, of whom all are women, and all are neighbours.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, spices, edible oil, lentils, rice, etc. and for making a display case for her shop.

loans.name: Nelson Alexander

texts.es: Nelson tiene 20 años de edad desde hace tres años aproximadamente traba como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Nelson es un hombre visionario quien desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de la integridad de Nelson ya que es un joven responsable y trabajador. Nelson solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación  del techo de la vivienda y de una pared la cual se encuentra en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comparará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Nelson is 20 years old, and for approximately three years he has worked for a company that is close to where he lives.  He is a visionary man who wants to improve the conditions in which he lives.  Many people attest to his integrity, since he is a hardworking and responsible young man.  He is seeking this loan though FUSAI so that he can repair the ceiling and a wall in his home, which are currently in bad shape.  With the loan funds he will purchase wood and galvanized sheet metal.

loans.use: to purchase laminated sheet metal and wood in order to repair the roof and a wall in his home.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 26 years old, single, and supports three people. He does transportation, and he has been in business for four years. Right now his monthly income is KES 30,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 67,500, which he intends to use to purchase a motorbike.

He will improve his business with the anticipated profit. This is his third loan, and he successfully repaid his previous loan. His hopes and dreams are to have a stable and strong family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Jay Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
The group “Jay Maa Mangala Self-Help Group” has thirteen members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing with her raised hand is Droupadi, who is the leader of the group. 

Droupadi is a 52-year-old woman, married to a worker. They live in a small village in Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are in school. Droupadi lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. 

In order to help with all the family expenses, Droupadi has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling her produce to distributors for the past fifteen years. She supplies her rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Droupadi, together with the group Jay Maa Mangala Shg, is requesting a loan from Peoples Forum for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides and seeds, and to cover their operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and seeds, and to cover their operational costs.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Por Un Mejor Mañana Group

texts.es: Estrella es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Por un Mejor Mañana, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus niños que son menores de edad y están en primaria. Ella es porcicultora y también siembra todo tipo de hortalizas para su consumo y para venderle a sus vecinos. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 15 años ya que es una actividad que por tradición y ubicación de la zona se transmite con el pasar de los años, cuenta con una finca donde tiene estos cerdos y sembradas las hortalizas, su hermano le ayuda como peón, encargado del mantenimiento de esta finca. Desea este crédito para invertir en la compra de más animales, semillas para sembrar y herbicidas para el correcto cuidado. Esto le va a permitir apoyar económicamente a su hogar  ya que en la zona no existen otras fuentes de ingreso. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la buena atención y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en: Estrella is the president of the communal bank "Por un Mejor Mañana," in Banco Mujer.  She is 48 years old, and she lives with her husband and their minor children, who attend elementary school.  She is a pig farmer who also cultivates vegetables for her family's consumption and to sell to neighbors.  She's been doing this work for 15 years, because this is a traditional activity that has been passed down through the years in this area.  Estrella has a farm where she has her pigs and her vegetable crops.  Her brother helps her as a farmhand; he is in charge of maintaining the farm.  With this loan, Estrella wants to buy more animals, seeds to plant, and herbicides to care for her crops.  This will enable her to support her household financially, because in this area there are no other sources of income.  Estrella chose Fundacion Mujer because of the good service and low interest rates they offer.

loans.use: to buy pigs and seeds to plant

loans.name: Veronica Isabel

texts.es:
Verónica  tiene 46 años de edad,labora  en un centro de educacion como responsable administrativa  teniendo 7 años de laborar. Es soltera y con 3 hijos  a los  que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener y apoyar para que se desarrollen.

La señora Verónica se ha dado cuenta que debe mejorar su vivienda  construyendo una letrina  y repello de paredes , es por eso que tomó la decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora, por tal razón acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar  un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, hierro, ladrillos y pago de mano  de obra  para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda en la construccion de letrina y repello de paredes, para mayor comodidad  de la vivienda. Cabe señalar que por medio de esta obra brindará mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Veronica is 46 years old and has been working as a school administrator for seven years.  She is single and has three children to support and develop.

Veronica realized that she needed to make improvements to her home by building a bathroom and plastering the walls, so she decided to approach CEPRODEL so she could buy building materials like cement, iron bars, bricks, and pay for labor to start the work and improve the comforts of her home.  It’s worth mentioning that this work will improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.
